It's racial profiling without evidence! Yet no one anticipated the pained reaction of the African American female college students. It hurts to be falsely accused with the threat of authority looming over you -- the realized moment when your life is no longer under your control.

The lack of professionalism of the officer or mall cop needs to be called into question also, for he also had the accountability to question the accuser to gauge the validity of the accusation before making an approach. Your staffer's description is seriously far too vague--one was seeking an African American to blame.

Applebee's--you need to execute your actions publicly with acknowledgement of the questionable and ill-warranted actions of YOUR brand staff. To be dismissive without any accountability does a disservice to your staff, your patrons, and your brands...all while further victimizing the heart of these young women.

SHAME ON YOU!!! And you wonder why there's a No Travel Warning for African Americans to venture into Missouri! You could be a conduit of unity and healing through this...but?

I am not one to complain on social media, but my attempt at dinner tonight at your South Boston, VA left me incredibly upset. My complaint is long winded, but I felt you should have all the details. I am a mother of 17 month old twins, and, needless to say, we dont go out to eat often-maybe once or twice a month- so tonight was a treat. 

We arrived a few minutes after 7pm as part of a party of 8 + two in high chairs and were seated promptly in a large corner booth, as the restaurant wasnt full. 
We had to ask for high chairs again 20 minutes later, and when they arrived two servers told me they couldnt have high chairs in the aisle and moved us to the booth directly beside our group. Ok, no big deal...so we moved the 4 of us over. I ordered a tea and French fries to keep the twins busy because dinner was impromptu and I had come straight from the babysitter and had no snacks in their bag. Thankfully, those made it to us. 

Approximately 40 minutes after we ordered, and 10-15 minutes after my husband had to walk over and ask the hostess to help us get our check because of the lack of service, his salad arrived. We had already packed up the diaper bag, and I had gotten one of the twins out of the high chair and sat him in my lap while we waited to pay for the untouched salad, tea, and fries. The beer my husband ordered when we sat down, along with our appetizer, had never made it to us. Let me interject at this point that our twins were still I good spirits and had not been fussy, which is always a plus when youre going out as a family. 

Right after the salad came my entree, and I was going to ask for a box, but when our server brought it and rudely dumped it on our table, she disrespected my family by saying loudly enough for several tables to hear, in regards to the twin still sitting and the two high chairs, These things are in the way! and pushed the empty one angrily (but wait, shes one of the two servers who moved us from one booth to the other...)

At this point I became very upset because her actions not only were uncalled for, but several tables started looking over at us. I stood up with the baby in my lap, grabbed the diaper bag, and walked to the waiting area by the front door to wait on my husband to pay.  It was at this point that twin started crying, so I walked out to put him in the car. 

My husbands entree came as I was standing up to leave, and he told the server we were leaving and that he wanted to pay for the tea and French fries we ate, like he told the hostess 10-15 minutes before we got any of the entrees. A server called a manager over, and he told my husband we had to pay for it all because it was already prepped. So, my husband asked to have the two entrees boxed, to which he was told they couldnt because his entree had already been taken back to the kitchen. As the final blow, he was told we had to pay for it all, even though we had been trying to get the check well before the entrees arrived at our table. 

So, nearly an hour after we had been seated, we went home $25 lighter, with no meal to show for it.

I just returned from the Palmhurst, Texas Applebees and ordered the Sriracha Shrimp because they look so good in the picture and in the description. I'm not sure what scam that location is pulling, but the shrimp looked like a larger sized version of Gordon's Popcorn Shrimp, soggy, and not tossed in any form of a "Sriracha" sauce as depicted in your pictures. In fact, the shrimp were basically brown popcorn shrimp drizzled with a small amount of a Chipotle/Southwest ranch type sauce. They were horrible and we sent them back. And the Quesadilla Burger was nothing more than meat and cheese with a small amount of sauce; none of the other ingredients were present ON the burger. Instead, a monster piece of white lettuce with 2 slices of tomatoes, 3 soggy red onion rings, and 3 pickle chips were brought on a side plate like a bizarre salad.  This really needs to be addressed because at this point, it was false advertisement, and shows a complete lack of consistency in your products.

Normally I'm not one to whine on social media, but being in customer service I'm extremely taken aback by my recent experience with first your restaurant and ultimately your online customer service. 

Saturday night I ordered takeout from your Suffolk, Virginia location and among my items was a Blondie. My wife noticed the brownie was very dry. When I attempted to heat it in the oven on low it did no good. It was at this point, at around 10 pm, that I decided to use the customer feedback link on your webpage. 

Apparently all this feedback page does is sign you up for junk email, because since Saturday I have received two emails for appetizer discounts with the purchase of an entree, but no actual person contacting me. Why would I want to eat at a place that values spam email over customer service?

When they finally get around to take your order, they seldom have anything to write it down with and chance it to memory.  When your appetizers finally arrives its either warm to cold.  Oh another thing,  when they bring your meal,  they tend too forget to bring all the order and the beer is flat. They need more training.   Never again. The Applebees on Parkchester is better.

We went to Applebees in Seneca, SC last night to see my brother in law back off to college. We were very excited to go because we haven't been in a while and we love Applebees. We were very disappointed though. We had a party of 13, 3 of the guests were children, and they sat us over in the bar area. I didn't think anything about it until several people behind us started lighting up. It is absolutely disgusting that you're allowed to smoke inside a restaurant, especially when there are children around. We were all coughing, and couldn't really enjoy the time we had with family. This is a family restaurant and we will not be coming back until there's no smoking in the building. If we wouldn't have already ordered, we would've left when we realized you could smoke there. I wasn't very impressed by the food or the amount of time out took to come out either, but the smoking was worse. It's a shame that you allow it in your establishment.

My family and i were excited to bring the new year in with some good drinks and food from Applebees last night... only for us to get to our local ABs and pretty much be denied service Bcuz my cousin is visiting from South Africa and she had South African identification. We had been to the same location a few nights before and our waiter and the manager present were extremely friendly and were open minded to the situation about her ID.... well the manager working on NYE and our waitress were extremely RUDE. Upon being seated we explained we wanted drinks and put in our food order. The waitress asked us for our IDs and we explained that my cousins ID was from South Africa. She immediately became very condescending and went and got the manager. The manager came and my cousin (who has an extremely strong SA accent) tried to explain and he didnt seem to understand so i began to explain. I explained she was visiting and had her SA I.D and he refused to look at it. Then after arguing with us for a few minutes i told him she had her passport but he still refused to see anything that wasnt American. He said it was all pretty much fake and if it wasnt American he wasnt trying to see it. He also said and i quote  i dont know the laws in South Africa so i cant serve you any drinks. I replied, it wouldnt matter what the drinking laws in any other country were as long as she met the requirements of the American laws. Shes 21 BTW. AND the laws in SA say you can drink once youre 18. So it STILL wouldnt matter. So long story short, the service that night was HORRIBLE. The waitress was rude and condescending AND the manager was being extremely prejudice ... its safe to say we had an awful countdown to the new year.

We recently went to Applebee's in Eau Claire, WI. We pulled in, and were pleasantly surprised to see this veterans parking sign. A simple gesture that started off a great experience. We were quickly seated and our server, Jake, quickly greeted us. He answered any questions we had about the menu and took our order. Our app came out lightening fast, and we hadn't finished it before the main course came out. I asked for a straw for my 4 year old's milk, and instead of just the straw, he brought back a cup with lid, and straw; another simple gesture. He came back periodically to check on us, and it wasn't too much to the point of being annoying, and it wasn't too little to leave me wanting something. Far and above, this was the best service we've ever had at an Applebee's and the best we've had anywhere in a long time.

Went for our annual Mother's Day get together on Saturday to the location in Lexington, NC.... not a good experience. For the price of this entree, this amount of chicken was very disappointing. There were 4 of us and we ordered 2 of the 2 for $20 with appetizers. 2 of us got our appetitzer (salad) quickly. We had time to eat it and wait 10 more minutes and the other appetizer (chicken) still hadn't come so we asked about it (they were NOT busy- the restaurant was less than half full). It came about 3 minutes later and was warm, at best. The entrees were another 15 minutes coming. Our server seemed to not know what to do so we didn't say anything else to her so as not to fluster her further and we did not bother to say anything to the manager because she was too busy propped up on the bar singing. She never walked around or spoke to anyone other than the employees the entire time we were there. That is surely not a requirement, but maybe if she walked around at least once every 30 minutes she would notice people waiting a long time for food. Apparently this location has ongoing isses because I see their rating on TripAdvisor is only a 3.5 and now we know why.

This seems very misleading to say the least.  My friends and I were a bit taken back when we ordered this "classic cheeseburger AND bacon cheeseburger as it clearly states and then simply asked which one by our waitress.  After she had to clarify that the sign is the perfect example of poor grammar and false advertising, we came to the realization that I wasn't indeed poorly educated and failed to understand the basics of the English language.  It just happened to be Applebee's poorly managed marketing team's oversight of the advertising that is displayed in the restaurant that created a little laugh at out table.  I hope someone that has the ability to correct such a misleading advertisement views this and can make the necessary changes.

Ordered carside to go tonight (4/17/17) from the Applebees in Westampton, Nj and this was my baked potato that came with my meal. I ordered it with bacon, cheese and sour cream... as you can see, no sour cream at all, the absolute smallest amount of cheese that i have ever seen in my life, and what the heck is up with that bacon? This was a huge disappointment and im pretty sure that would be unacceptable to serve to a table, so it shouldnt have been served as a to go order either. I also ordered a 6oz sirloin medium well and it was VERY well done and very hard to cut and chew. Our buffalo wings that we got as an appetizer barely had any sauce on them as well.  I was very disappointed in this meal and im hesitant about going back to that location because i have seen other reviews were not very good either.

Well I'm done giving this restaurant chances. It's been a couple of months since I've eaten at Applebee's. The last time I went the waitress was horrible. It took forever just to get our drink orders then after she took our order she left us sitting there and never checked on us. Finally after 30 minutes I had to ask a different server how much longer until we got our food. Our original waitress came to the table and told us she lost my family of fives entire order! She said they'll start cooking it right then, but by that time we were done waiting and went and grabbed fast food. The time before that there was a long piece of hair in my food. As soon as the waitress set it down I saw it and so did she. She was as grossed out as I was. She apologized and said they would remake my order. By the time my plate was brought out everyone else was done eating though. Tonight I ordered the 7oz Parmesan and shrimp sirloin with grilled vegetables and mashed potatoes. As soon as I cut into it it was tough. After hacking away at it I saw it was ALL GRISTLE! I tried to find spots on this small steak that weren't tough but couldn't. On top of that the vegetables were raw. My boyfriend and kids didn't even waste their time with this restaurant they ordered out at Ruby Tuesday's and their food was delicious! I've wasted way too much money on Applebee's and tonight is the last night I'll ever spend another penny there!

Applebee's in Clermont Florida not very good in their food quality. I asked specifically for a well-done 12 ounce steak and I particularly asked them not to burn it, they bring it to me and I noticed the blood in the plate, To verify my suspicion, I cut open the steak, and it appeared to be cooked medium well. My server takes it back comes five minutes later charred. My server who was fantastic asked me if I wanted the steak remade and I had no choice but to say no because my coworker had to go back to clock in for his lunchtime. This is the second time that I've ordered this same meal and they never have this so-called 12 ounce and I end up getting two 6 inch steaks. I guess 6+6 = 12 ounces ;-) I guess I'll be looking for a new place for lunch ;-)

status_message: I'm not one to normally complain, but in what world does this look appetizing? It looks like someone ate my food and regurgitated it back up. I can chew food just fine...don't need the help.

I placed an order online at the Applebees in North Charleston SC on Ashley Phosphate road and got the worst service ever. My order was for car side and was to be ready by 4:27pm. I sat and waited until 4:40pm and decided to see what was going on with my order. The response we don't have anyone working Carside today. It would be nice to have a sign posted saying that. I go inside for my order and it wasn't ready. I was told we didn't make it because we are out of steak, and what would I like them to do. I said nothing I'd just like a refund. The guy says let me talk to my manager. In a very rude voice I got "you can't have cash back, so what would you like to do (very rude voice). You know you can only get it back on your card." I didn't ask for cash, so why would it be assumed that I was expecting cash. I'm fully aware that it has to come back on my card. He then said "well it's going to take 3 days can you wait (very rude voice)" I'm well aware I just want my refund. He then said " well you won't have proof of the refund" I said well you can write something out. There was no apologies or anything. They wasted my time and energy. They could've been apologetic and could've contacted me to make sure I knew what was going on. I will spreading the word on all of my special media outlets and make them aware of the poor service. That applebees should be shut down.

Why doesn't Applebee's have a notice or a message on this tablet that is on every table in their restaurants indicating that if you answer any of the trivia questions you will be CHARGED A FEE TO PLAY.  It might not be much but it would be an unpleasant surprise to many customers who are tempted to answer the trivia questions but aren't aware that they are being charged to test their trivia smarts.

We had 2 employees deal with our table. Utensils were so dirty and full of oil, it made our stomach turn. I was applaud seeing  such dirty utensils. This means the leadership is this store is not being held accountable. For this to happen at such a beautiful location is a darm shame. Someone from corporate should do a QC. Visit unannounced as a customer. Then, I asked for non-alcoholic pina coladas. One was ok. The other was down right pathetic. No flavor and it looked like no passion was put into making the drinks. Work of art destroyed. The male server didn't seem so real as being sorry for the errors. The female server was. She did her best to do a service recovery. As for the male server. We didn't as being truely sorry. As a establishment. Everyone should be held to a very high standard. From the dish washer all the way to the manager. Everyone should be held accountable. Become a world class location so people can come back. This was the 1st time at this location and will probably be the last. I surely was not impressed at all.

We recently had a terrible experience at the applebees in Country Club hills, IL. We arrived at 5:01 & were immediately seated but no waiter came to the table to bring us water or anything. After waiting 25 minutes my mother asked a waitress who was supposed to be serving us & she said she didn't know. She apologized & said she would help us. She came back & told us that she doing out who our server was supposed to be & his reason for not serving us was because "he was. busy & hopes that someone else would serve us" .We placed our orders & did not receive our drinks, water or food until 6:15. My mother spoke to the manager & he gave us coupons  nobody came to clean any of the tables from previous customers, the bathrooms were disgusting & we didn't leave until 7:00pm. Idk what the hell Applebee's agenda is but I won't be going back.

I went out of my way on Wed evening to pick up dinner from your south Joliet location. This was the absolute worst visit I have ever had. The drinks took awhile to come out. Part of the dinner deal came out first. We said we hadn't got the appetizer yet. So the mgr looks at us and said so you want this to go back? Yes. Appetizers go out first. So that was about 7:30. I sit with no drink for awhile. My daughter need a refill for about 10-15 min. Stuff I asked for with the order I had to ask for again. She comes out at 8:18 and says she has the cooks making our dinner. We were about to just leave. And about 10min later(8:28) the steak came out. The potatoes were cold. I said I don't like onions and the other side was full of them. I just wanted to leave. My daughter gets a box so I put what I had left of my steak in it. We see the bill and she only took off $10. And we asked to talk. She tried to tell me that's all she can do. That is complete B.S. we been here that long. The dinner screwed up. Finally got it and it was not worth it. Not eating it but paying that much. But she thinks 10 made up for it. status_message: Had dental work done I thought I would buy 2 soups from your store on coors.. I got two cups both not even halfway full. Didn't want to drive back wasn't feeling well... is this normal?

Normally I am a huge Applebee's fan. After tonight however, I am very disapointed. The night started out by my party of four ordering a round of Long Island Ice Teas. We waited so long for our drinks to get brought to us that we felt compelled to instantly order another round so that our second set of drinks would get served to us during our meal time and not afterwards. 

When it came time to order, I ordered the half rack of ribs, and the other people in my party ordered other items. We waited an abnormally long time for our food to get served, but we weren't bothered by this until our food got brought to the table. When my "half rack of ribs" were placed in front of me, I was at a loss for words. I couldn't believe how small they were. I have never been served such a pathetic rack of ribs in my life. I guess the menu forgot to mention that the "half rack of ribs" actually come from a hampster...  Very disappointing, especially from a restaurant I love and frequent often.
So excited for Applebees to go....couldn't wait for the apple chutney pork chop....no apples, no maple butter :( and under cooked meat. Please God, no more stomach flu/illness...

Way to go applebees. Tonight you dropped the ball on our service. The lady and i showed up and waited 15 min to be seated at a table that was open before we arrived later we ordered 2 long Island I've teas, 1 large blue moon, 1 spinach dip app, 1 3 cheese cav, and 1 classic combo. The appetizer showed up right after the drinks and was up to temp and an ok amount but my blue moon was not. It tasted more like a cheap homemade hoppy craft beer but i drank it without even saying a word because I'm the type of person to not complain but as you can see, tonight is going to be an exception. Later our main meals come to the table and the first thing we noticed is that the 3 cheese cav had 3 thin strips of chicken and a tablespoon of tomato slices. The lady said this isn't going to work and the waitress took it back to "fix it". In the meantime i said let's eat some dip while we wait for your food. The first bite i took was slightly over chilled and the cheese was not melted. So to keep my cool, i just didn't eat the rest and thought to take it home for later. The lady's food finally got back and we noticed all they did was add a 4th strip of chicken and more cheese and we gleamed at it thinking all of that for just under 13 dollars is just not anywhere near worth it so after that we just sat and ate what we had. Like i said, we aren't ones to complain about service but tonight is different. Also i decided to leave a survey about our service but half way through i got this screen after clicking next to leave comments about the service. Nikki Neely

My husband and I were at the Applebee's in Fountain Colorado on 19Feb17 for dinner.  The food was not too bad for a large chain that I would only presume is heated up prepared meals.  My issue is with the gadget on you tables that we were informed was called Ted.  I guess you can order drinks, appetizers, deserts and pay your bill on this Ted.  We don't like nor want to use Ted.  Not sure what you need wait staff for if you expect all to use this gadget.  My issue is when we wanted to pay the waitress never came to the table with the bill.  We even alerted Ted that we needed the waitress to come to the table.  She never came.  We than went to the register and was informed that we could go back to our table and pay using Ted.  We told the young man no.  When the waitress finely came so that we would pay she was rather disinterested and rather put out.  She stood with her foot out hand on hip looking up in  the air rolling her eyes.  Not sure how she expects a tip with that attitude nor how she expects to keep her job with Ted around.  I do believe it will be good little bit before I am inclined to return to an Applebees.

Just stopped in for some baby backs to go and just realized something very disappointing.  Applebee's is skimping on portion size big time. We ordered 2 full racks of ribs and neither was even CLOSE to a full rack by definition - 7 in one order and 9 in the other.  But it makes sense, if you only serve 1/2 - 2/3 of a rack per customer just think of how low your food costs will be!  I would think happy customers would be more important but what do i know? The only reason I am posting is this isn't the first time I've had issues with this specific meal at your Littleton NH location. Once my wife and I ordered this same meal and her steak came out twice the size of mine. When we talked to our server, on both occasions, they said that the steak had shrunk. Not impressed!

I went to the Brownsburg, IN restaurant on 2/17/17 at 4:00 p.m. with my teenage son.  The Server's name was Maleah. My ticket # was 354-523582. I ordered the 6oz steak, medium, for myself and the ribs for my son.  The steak came and did not look like a "top sirloin"l, let along "Choice".  It actually looked like a Utility cut, the lowest grade.  I told the server to stay while I cut into it.  I used the steak knife and could hardly cut through it.  Once I cut two pieces off, I tried to chew one and had to spit it out, it was too tough.  I asked the server if she could hear me chewing on it and she agreed that she did hear me trying to chew through it.  She said she would get me another steak.  In the meantime, l I ate the fries and veggie that came with it. It took forever for the new steak to arrive.  When it did, it sure looked lonely on that big plate.  It was Okay.  When the server brought the bill, I was a bit confused.  It showed that I ordered 2 steaks but only one showed the following ***COMP***.  The manager never came to discuss it. A VERY disappointing experience.

Way to show portion control.... I could have gotten more with a child's order!!! Come on... and this is what I was given from messing up me order last week?? Way to make up for it. I'll never be going back again.

Went to Applebees and they gave me raw shrimp! I've ordered this dish numerous of times! I have never seen a staff so rude and a manager so unbothered about this. My children food was cold and completely disgusting!! I will be calling corporate and writing a letter!

So my friend Shalease Wilson && I came to Applebee's tonight && we decided to sit at the bar. So we are waiting to get served && it's only one person working at the bar && today is a holiday so I would assume that she will have some help but instead of getting help the bartender is getting fussed out because she a little behind. From our understanding she is a beginner. Now there is a manager behind her just talking to her any kind of way. Literally fussing at her in front of customers! So we as paying customers are seeing this right in front of our faces, which is so unprofessional that we all feel like we wouldn't want to come to this Applebee's anymore. So I decided to tell to the GM Manager && he didn't even care! Didn't even apologize or even make the disruption better! He just stood there and didn't say anything! Like he just didn't care! I was at the Albany Georgia Applebee's and I promise you I would never come back again! YOU EVEN HAVE CUSTOMERS ROLLING SILVERWARE!!!! Like where is the professionalism?!

Yesterday I placed an order on  the app at the Graham WA Applebee's for chicken wonton tacos but got this. He said he would email me a e-gift card but couldn't even get my info right even though I spelled every letter out for him. He hung up on me and I have yet to get this e-gift card. I gotta say Applebees.... I'm extremely disappointed in your "Top Shelf Long Island Iced Tea" now as a previous bartender I know what this drink consists of: Gin, Tequila, Vodka, Rum, Triple Sec, Sour Mix and a splash of coke. Honestly you'd be lucky to fit one shot with sour and coke in this glass considering how much ice it has. Not only that, the fact that it's so watered down makes it worse. The drink was consumed in literally 3 maybe 4 sips. Now we love Applebee's but sadly EVERYTIME we come it's the same disappointment with this drink. Maybe you should cut the Ridiculous amount of ice or try a different glass bc if I'm paying top shelf money I expect to have my top shelf drink. Or at the very least a Long Island that consists of all the Ingredients with the correct amount of ice so it does not water down. Thank you.

Me and my boyfriend are both in the national guard. After a long day at drill today we decided to stop at Applebee's for some dinner before going home, Expecting to sit down, eat our dinner, and go home. Almost as soon as we walked in the door multiple people had thanked us and one very nice lady came up to us before we even got our table and offered to buy our dinner. I have never had anyone do anything like for me. We told her wasn't necessary but she insisted. It was very nice of her and I want to thank her very much for that. It's people like that that make our jobs worth working. It made me want to cry and hug her. The service was great and our server was very nice.
When you asked for no pink( Well Done)and they give you the WHOLE cow

Me and my husband went to Applebee's today for dinner and the experience was horrible!!! The waitress was great but the food and manager was awful! My husband ordered his steak medium rare, it was "blue rare" - it looked raw!!! I ordered my steak medium, it was rare! I like a little pink in mine but mine was red. I sent mine back and my husband quickly went to the bathroom and threw up after eating a couple bites of his. The manager came out with my second steak and I told him my husband doesn't want his, it's way to rare. He looked at my husbands steak and said "he did order medium rare right" I said "yes he did but that's not medium rare" he offered another steak but I said no because my husband lost his appetite. As soon as I said that, the manager Pedro became rude cut me off and walked away saying he would take it off our check. I didn't even cut into my second steak because like my husband, I lost my appetite as well. We paid for 2 beers, the appetizer, and my meal which I didn't even eat. Thought you might want to know you Altus Oklahoma resturant needs new management and all new staff.

Hello,

We are a small New York-based startup with a mission to save the planet by reducing food waste, feed the hungry and help food businesses make an extra revenue. You can join today - its completely free and you will get the chance to sell the surplus food that ends in the bin at the end of your service. Interested in joining our cause?

This is how it works: 

You list the surplus food (which was going to waste at the end of service) on our app and state the time when customers can come and pick it up.

The amount of meals is unlimited and completely under your control, as well as the time of collecting. You will be paid half of the original price of the meal,This leaves you with a hassle-free closedown, more money in your pocket and the exposure to new potential customers.

Lets reduce food waste, protect the planet and feed some bellies together!

We would love to hear from you and get you started on this great cause, you can reach us at contactus@noonesleepshungry.com

Watch a small video to learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=09C46H_XeVw

Regards,

No One Sleeps Hungry Team

http://www.noonesleepshungry.com/

No One Sleeps Hungry for Business

First and foremost I want to say our waitress and the manager was great! Sadly we did not have a great visit at the Applebee's on northwest expressway in okc today. Stopped in there to have lunch because I received gift cards for Christmas from my father. We ordered the spinach artichoke dip and it came out burnt, black and brown all the way around the dish and then also on the top. Asked for a new one because it tasted awful. Got my second one and it was great. My daughters boyfriend got the chicken tenders basket and the chicken was almost none was pretty much just the breading yuck. My daughter and my friend both got the mac n cheese and they both hated it. They wasn't alone the lady setting behind us ordered the same thing and also didn't eat it because it was nasty. I got the southwestern chicken salad glad I did pretty hard to mess that up so all in all I was the only one that ended up getting to eat. The manager did offer to replace their food but we didn't have time to wait for  more food.  So we go to leave I had to go to the restroom and look up to find that. Yes that is black mold!! That can and will make people very sick, as on my way out I started to have an asthma attack and had to stop to use my inhaler. Sadly we came in from Tulsa to get some shopping done but I will remember this one restaurant and we will not be able to return to it sadly. Please please make sure someone fixes that in the women's restroom!

status_message: So we are pretty partial to the Applebees in Pineville.  We have been going to that one for years.  We even did a pancake breakfast in 2010 for CF.  The manager Linda is amazing!  She wouldn't take their part out for pancake breakfast as we didn't sell much.  She comes and sees us every time we are in there.  Anyway we decided to do lunch today for our anniversary as this was where we went on first date.  We had no idea this was coming. Went into our check on the tablet to pay and it said zero so we decided to ask for it. This is what we got.  Their our good people out there!  Thank you Applebees and Linda!

Special thanks to Applebee's of Baldwin, for hosting our South Shore Sharks fundraiser this morning!  Our manager and staff were on their game today preparing over 100 breakfast meals.  All in all it was a successful event and it helped our travel baseball team raise a significant amount of funds.  Our deepest gratitude to Applebee's from the Sharks players, parents and families!

Meet Leroy Inman, Jr., team member at Applebees in Jacksonville, NC. I've been working at Applebee's 6 years. I take a lot of pride in my work because my father took a lot of pride in his work. My dad did 10 years in the Army, and he also served in the Marines. He was very proud to serve his country. At Applebee's on Veterans Day, we honor service men and women to show our gratitude and our thanks. It makes me real proud that I can help them. Veterans Day is a chance to come together as a team and serve those who served us. Watch the video here: http://bit.ly/LeroyInman #ThankYouMovement #VeteransDay
Every Veteran deserves a thank you. Say it yourself & join the #ThankYouMovement.

Dearest Applebees,

BABYGIRL! When will you bring your services to the Los Angeles area! How much longer must I wait to have your delicious mozzarella sticks within a reasonable distance from me. I have waited, I have stood proud, stood firm in waiting. Many have tried to replace you; B dubs, T.G.I.Fridays,, the cheesecake factory, the numerous organic hip Los Angeles restaurants who serve organic vegan, grass fed mozz cheese covered in low calorie high multi-vitamin grain breaded sticks. But no, you have been too good to me to hurt, the only woman in my life whose never hurt me (i may have cheated on you with Pizza Hut's stuff crust pizza but you knew I was gonna be right back, like HOV says). How, after all we been through, you make me have to travel an estimated 20+ miles (In LOS ANGELES) for these sticks! You know how much of a surge an uber be at peak half price app hours! YOU PREACH "MHH EATING GOOD IN THE NIEGHBOORHOOD" not "MHHH EATING GOOD IN THE COUNTY NEXT TO YOU FAM COME ON OVER" 

With Kind Regards,
Craig

We went into the north Babylon, NY location for drinks and apps. 3 drinks. We ordered the original combo appetizer.  The boneless wings came out so over cooked you couldn't cut them with a knife. The celery was literally rotten (I have pics for proof). The spinach dip was so over microwaved that it tasted like fish. They replaced our wings in about three minutes  (how do you cook wings that quickly?) And the celery on this plate was even more rotten. 
When the manager Katie came over and we explained our issue her first response was "I didn't know they were sending out rotten food". Really? As a manager you don't know what is leaving your kitchen... but your kitchen staff absolutely knew they were sending out bad food. 
All in all she took the appetizer off the bill. The only good thing about this place was the bartender Dara.
So much for new ownership and staff.

I truly hope this person isn't one of your employees. A manager, nonetheless. Blaming Tara Hickey for her child's injury because a door wasn't operating properly at one of your restaurants? Hi I'm the daughter in law of Becki (Rebecca) Horton. I started a gofundme page for her husband Danny Horton; I will also post updates when they are available. Danny has been diagnosed with small cell lung cancer; the tumor is so large his right lung is collapsed. He has started chemotherapy treatments and soon will start radiation as well. These treatments are taking a toll on him. He has been unable to work for the past month, and we're not sure when he will be able to return to work. He was the main provider for the both of them. If you're able to make a contribution of what ever size please do so. I provided the link above. Please share the gofundme link on your Facebook page and by mouth. The name of the gofundme is "Help for Danny Horton". Prayers are greatly appreciated.
Thanks in advance,
Mindy McJunkin

She cut into it and it was rare, she asked for a medium steak. After lunch the manager came over to chat with us and he actually tired to argue what the steak was cooked to and that this was medium. If this is his idea of medium he needs to go back and retake his food handler exam. My husband is a chef I sent him a picture he told me that was really rare. You need to teach your managers better food handling or someone is going to get sick. And  since both of our lunches where over salted and uncooked we ended up eating an hour later after my appointment. Very disappointing.. That's the medium cooked steak...

My sister and I went to the Duluth, MN Applebee's after a very long and scorching 92+ degree day for half-off apps. We were warned about food shortages and long waits due to fact they were running on generators (Over 70,000 power outages from a severe and 70-100 mph storm). We didn't mind since we had seen the damage around town...power lines down and multiple-decades old trees uprooted. Our waitress informed us that they were almost out of food already just from the day "and didn't know what they were going to do for the weekend!" As we were waiting for our food we noticed an older couple who were also waiting for their food. I could feel the impatience from their table. He kept glancing at the floor, she kept pointing her finger, and taking pictures of "the mess." Then when they received their food they asked "we've been waiting an hour....if it was even warm still?....now we're going to have to eat at McDonald's" (The scene they were making caused people to stare) They paid for their drinks and walked out. Now I can understand being hungry and wanting it to be tasty and warm. But this situation exuded disrespect to our town itself. This entire situation is entirely out of everyones control and to take it out on the waitress was uncalled for. 70,000 people were without power and had to eat somewhere! (Keep in mind that at least a 1/5 of the city's restaurants weren't even open due to the outages). Our waitress, Alicia was so kind and funny after having worked through the entire day. I applaud the entire staff at the Duluth, MN Applebee's tonight. If it weren't for the repetition of apologies that we heard around us I barely would have noticed how swamped, exhausted, and short-stocked you really were. Five golden stars to each of you.

I had an extremely horrid experience at the Jonesboro location on Tara Blvd. I almost feel like this location should be shut down because it's reputation in Atlanta proceeds it...but sadly...I did not know prior to doing research after my first and last experience there.  My sister, my spouse, and I went out to celebrate my spouse's birthday yesterday.  The service was horrible. Our waiter...a young man with an amazing beard who never introduced himself to us...was the worst server I've experienced anywhere in my life. We ordered a steak by the name printed on the menu and his response was that his mind debt work line that...that he didn't know what we were trying to order...and that we should have just called out the ounces of the steak and then he'd have known what we were trying to order.  He does not have the personality required for the service industry.  He was subjective, and would get upset when we would politely say things to him or ask him things.  He would disappear from his section for extended periods of time and return with nothing or little to nothing to explain his elongated absence. The table behind us grew impatient and demanded to be moved to another section. After continued poor service and more than an hour wait for appetizers, they brought out the 2 steak meals and both were wrong.  They added shrimp parm to one, and his response was if you're not allergic to shrimp then that's a plus for you...free shrimp. But she didn't want shrimp...she could easily have afforded it if she did. He didn't offer to take it back and she said it was fine because she didn't have the patience to wait an hour.  We waited for one of our non-alcoholic drinks for about 20 min. When my spouse's steak meal came out it was completely the wrong meal (1 steak not 2, no eggs, and also topped with shrimp parm) but with the sides that she ordered.  We explained that hers was wrong too. Our waiter said her food was in his hand and put down the steak and eggs, but with the wrong sides. She told him she didn't order that and explained that the plate with the wrong steak were the sides she ordered and our waiter argued with her that they weren't (but they were). He took it all back and brought it back out about 8 minutes later and it was cooked well, but she'd ordered medium-rare. At that time the waiter tells us he winged it with putting our order in. As we were still waiting for the steak to come back as ordered, I started eating my salad. Embedded down in the stack of lettuce was this dead fly. When I very calmly and politely explained how our night had gone to the manager, I told her a bug in my food was the final straw and we were leaving. I paid for our alcoholic beverages and appetizers because we'd consumed them. The manager then said the fly probably fell from the ceiling above me (no apology that I'd almost eaten a disease-ridden fly in their restaurant). I told her if it fell from the ceiling then it had to happen in the kitchen because lettuce, cheese, and croutons were on top of the fly.  Still without an apology, she took the plate, left the table, and sent a young woman over to deliver the bill for the drinks and apps. This was the worst dining experience of my life...and ruined my spouse's 31st birthday dinner.
This is the most disgusting thing I've seen in a long time. What are you going to do about it Applebees?

Hi Applebee's. I'm writing to just tell you about an experience my wife and I had at our local restaurant yesterday. We always like eating at it because usually the food is great and the people that work there are awesome but yesterday I really can't say we had a great dinner. We started out with our drinks which were good as always and then placed our order. This is when everything went to crap. Our food came out wrong, burnt, and part of my dinner was on her plate and vise versa. Never has this happened. Mine went back once before they got it right. The wife's not so much. They were informed of a food allergy my wife has to mushrooms. Her food had to go back twice because of burnt food and mushrooms under her chicken. The manager was great! Made sure our food was prepared right before we got them. I guess what really pisses me off is when the bill came. I'm not one for wanting anything for free but to see my receipt is a slap in the face. If your going to comp the meal, don't basically say " f that they are paying" by taking the meal off the bill and then put it back on! This is making me not ever want to set foot back in this restaurant ever again!! I posted my receipt with this comment so you can see why I'm pissed!!!
You might be busy, but you can still get a real meal.

I ordered the New Blazin' Texan burger tonight from apple bees. It looks nothing like the photo pictured on your website. I am highly disappointed as I am after most of my visits to your restaurant. Pictured is what I received.

I just had the most extraordinary experience at your location in Springfield, IL. We were traveling from St. Louis to Chicago when we stopped to grab something quick and stretch our legs. We have a 5 year old and an 8 week old. We had just been greeted by our server when I looked around for the diaper bag and realized it was still sitting where we left it back in St. Louis. I am the kind of mom who packs half of her life in her diaper bag with excruciating attention to detail. So, upon finding out we didn't have everything we needed for our journey, my exact reaction was not pretty. Not to mention, our youngest was wearing a pretty full diaper. My husband asked the hostess for directions to the nearest store, but I encouraged him to sit down, eat, and go to the store after our meal as everyone was starving and both kids were extremely cranky (as were we!) Shortly after our food arrived, our server walked up to our table and wordlessly dropped these two items on the edge. They had gone out and gotten us a full package of both diapers and wipes. She shared that she's a mom of four and she knows what is like to run out of what you need. The service and food were great, but this stranger's kindness is utterly remarkable. We appreciate you more than you will ever know, Kelly T. Thank you for assuring us that there are still wonderful people in this world.

just posted this to Yelp. This was the Blasdell NY location.

Absolutely awful experience and will never eat there again. My wife and I go there for a date night. This was supposed to be our buy one get one up to $20 our uncle gave us for Christmas. She ordered a quesadilla burger and I ordered shrimp wonton stir fry. Then the problems start. 

After about 15 minutes my wife's shows up. She receives her burger first. It's basically some lettuce and cheese one a tortilla, with a burger patty smaller than your typical whopper. She receives sweet potatoe fries, very few of them. Now bare in mind they charge like $12 for this, you'd get a bigger meal for $5 at Wendy's. Oh it's also cold. 

So time is ticking another 10 minutes. My order isn't there.  Waitress asks and I tell her I hadn't received my order. It shows up shortly after. I take two bites and there is a hair in it. I send it back. The manager comes over and asks me what I want. Offers to ring it up so I can still use my coupon (gee thanks) and offers a free dessert but I don't eat desserts I'm not a sweet tooth. So I said I guess I just want something else so order the cedar salmon.

So I'm sitting there sitting there, it's going on 20 minutes. I tell the waitress this is ridiculous and just pack it to go. So anyway the manager has the waitress comp the meal. Doesn't matter at this point because I didn't have the meal yet! So after this I'm still waiting for the meal, and I told my wife if it wasn't there in a few minutes we were just going to leave. At this point I'm just feeling bad about wasting the food, I'm angry,  they ruined our date night which we get few of and our Christmas gift from my uncle.

So the meal arrives in its to go bag, I leave. I get home to maybe 5 small cubes of potatos with a few spinach leaves and a tiny salmon steak, and by tiny I mean tiny. You could buy an equal size piece of salmon frozen at the dollar tree for $1. And they still wanted me to pay $15 for this! 

There are tons of good local restaurants that will treat you better than this, don't waste your time. Even if you get a gift certificate it might not be worth your hassle.

My parents and I went to Applebee's to celebrate my birthday. I live in Hugo, OK and we drove to Paris, TX and got it to go. So after getting there the waitress took the order and then when it came time to bring our the food a different lady brought the food to us but forgot to put it into to go boxes. So then my Father went to go pay and the original lady who took the order took payment but short changed my Father by $5.00 luckily my Father caught it and she didn't hesitate to give it back. So we get home and my Mom's hamburger was overlooked (see photo) and the tomato and lettuce was left off. My Cheeseburger was overlooked too but it doesn't bother me. So she had to throw her hamburger out and share my Fathers Hamburger Quesadilla with him. 

We will not be eating at Applebee's again. It was really disappointing especially since it was my birthday. 

The waitress who took the order was a redhead who wore glasses, and had a Chicago Cubs jersey on.
Thank you SO MUCH FOR LISTENING and bringing back the regular nachos!!!!! Happy camper right here!!!!

It's been awhile since I've eaten at Applebee's at my husband wanted to go last night. We were exhausted and decided to order some food to go and enjoy at home. I scrolled thru the online menu and decided on this. It looked different and sounded good. What I received when I got home was nothing even close! It was very very cold and tasted more like a cold cut deli lunch wrap! I gave them the benefit of the doubt since it was take out, but then I saw that the cheese wasn't even partially melted and no sauce. I couldn't even finish half of the wrap. The wrap itself also tasted like raw read right out of the bag, it wasn't toasted or anything! It was so late I didn't even bother calling the restaurant as I was too tired to drive back out. If I was at the restaurant I would have sent the food back and I never do that. I have additional photos below of what it should be and what it actually looked like. I really hope this is not what your restaurants have dropped to. Just disappointed to waste $10 into the trash  Greer, SC location curbside service 8:30pm

Never once asking me anything...she even puts a "to go" container next to my food as my empty beer sits there (i came here last night and tipped her 5$ on a 15$ tab and she even recognized me)
Im not one to typically complain because i understand the service industry is stressful...hut she has blatanly disregarded me as a patron and a human being. The whole time ive been here ive kept to myself and havent been loud or obnoxious to deserve to be ignored. Im not sure if ill ever be back to applebees.

status_message: Hey thanks to the Applebee's on Jones Maltsberger for treating me like crap on my visit.  I ordered to go, including two of my favorite loaded mashed potatoes and a cheeseburger.  When I got there I was told they weren't ready, even though the food was sitting right on the bar.  A few minutes later they realized it was actually my food and gave it to me, even though it had been sitting cold for 15 minutes.  Then when I got back to my hotel, I opened up my mashed potatoes and lo and behold, they weren't even loaded---see the photos.  Nope.  Just regular mashed potatoes even though I had paid for the loaded ones.  Oh and there was no cheese on my cheeseburger.  Avoid the Applebee's on Jones Maltsberger if at all possible.
A tasty reason to celebrate #NationalBlondeBrownieDay.

Last night's dining experience at the Applebee's in Lancaster, Pa ranks up there as the worst dining experience ever.  Waited 15 minutes for server to approach our table, ordered water and a glass of wine, water came, no wine, 10 minutes later wine arrives.  We placed our order which included an appetizer, soup and entrees.  My husband's entree was served 45 minutes after we arrived, looked like it had been dropped on the floor and was cold.  Also it arrived BEFORE the appetizer, the soup and my entree.  I commented to the server about his entree being served before the appetizer and soup and she shrugged her shoulders and said, they were all put in the kitchen....huh?  When she served my husband's cold entree I requested another glass of wine, 10 minutes after my husband's entree was served another person brought out the appetizer, COLD, the soup and my entree....another bit time passes and our original server comes back and and I have to remind her of the glass of wine I ordered....she says 'oh yea'....15 minutes later that finally arrives.  No dishes were cleared from our table.  The appetizer was served with 4 pieces of celery that were so thin you could see thru them and a minute offering of blue cheese. There wasn't even enough blue cheese  for the meager amount of celery.  My Thai salad consisted of literally 6 pieces of lettuce, some shrimp, about 10 edamame, maybe a teaspooon of sliced almonds and what appeared a cole slaw mix.  We were not alone, the table across from us were served their soup after an extended wait and had to request utensils, from 2 different people!!  Our check arrived, without even asking if we wanted dessert or anything else, which we didn't by now we were pretty fed up (no pun intended), and when it was brought back to us it was mixed up with another table's, the server handed us someone elses credit card!  The hosts and manager seemed oblivious to the issues going on as they chatted about personal issues and personel at the host stand.  In all we were there for over an hour and a half!  I really don't know what was worse, the service or the food.  From speaking with friends and family, this is not an unusual experience at this location.  I imagine the only reason the place is still in business is located in a very busy area!

I have always had pleasant experiences at Applebee's. Whether it was a birthday or a family gathering, it would always be the first choice for me and my family. Being said my husband and I decided that since our youngest daughter was turning five, we would go and have dinner at Applebee's.(Located at 1305 West Chester Pike, Havertown, PA)  As we received our appetizer, I took the dressing cup off my salad plate and found a broken piece of a glass cup underneath the dressing cup. I was sharing some of my salad with my daughter and she had almost eaten it. She could have gotten  seriously injured if she had. After the finding, we called the manager and she apologized immediately and offered to get us a new plate of food. But we were very disappointed. We could have gotten seriously injured. We were very lucky we had seen it. But this experience made both my family and I very upset. And we don't know if we will be returning to this Applebee's ever again.

I had a to go order. We ordered 4 triple choc meltdown. We decided to pay with the free triple choc meltdown cards that were sold by Applebees in Sams club. The manager came and said that we would have to make a payment for those.I argued with him that why would I pay for it when I have already pre paid for it when I bought this promotion from Sams club. He charged me $15 which I paid. After that I asked the corporate number to which he said that they don't have corporate number. After that he left and did not return. After 5-10 mins a lady returned and said the same thing. Now my concern is, is that how a manager suppose to do? Run away from a situation? I bring a party of 15-20 to this Applebees every two months because I own a restaurant and I bring my employees here for some occasion. I need to know why Applebees selling such a card when the manager says they don't accept it for more than a $2 value.  I have paid for it already and now I have to pay for it again? I'm an honest and generous customer who needs an answer. Now why would Applebees run that promotion then?

Awesome free Christmas event for children in Jackson . Also a very cheap skating event in Hillsdale in the groups effort to help raise money and/or presents so some children don't wonder why santa passed them this year.

New Update Please Share::::We are working so hard daily to make this event over the top. The guys have been working really hard. I am also adding to the event an outdoor movie theater for cartoons.Will have cupcakes,cookies, treats, small toys(not Presents). Major light show. 
Please Share!!!!!
On Sunday Dec 20th at 6:00 pm. I am having SANTA and Mrs Santa at my house and a HUGE MAGIC MAILBOX all fenced in for the kids all kids not just kids in need. The yard will be lit up with animals/ characters. You can get pics with Santa and get a candy cane and just a very small toy but NOT PRESENTS though.  From Santa only until I run out.  Free to all children. Tons of volunteers including Professional DJ to play Christmas music. Photographer taking Pics,Santa and Mrs Santa ,light show ,Cookies and fun stuff. This event will be a nice family time event. Plus their will be a drawing two children's letters will be drawn for a gift card. 

HILLSDALE SKATING RINK also wants to help in getting donations to adopt families in need for Christmas. We are also holding an event there. For our group on the 20th 2 pm to 5pm . We will also have Santa there. They are donating all admission money to help adopt families in and around Hillsdale. Please come to the group Everybody Needs A Santa!!!  To get into the event invite.I will be creating the event invite tomorrow.  Everyone's invited. 

 I am accepting any volunteers to help set up With us as a community for event in Jackson and help with this. There's a lot to set up so it would be great. Also Someone to help by playing Santa and Mrs Santa when mine get tired. Help in Passing out cookies, candy canes. 
For anyone that would like to bring a last minute toy to donate to one of the many children I have on the list I have a big list of children with really good reasons like a parent passed away and such. For Santa to deliver them a Present there will be a bin for toys. Only a choice thing. 
I'm gonna work so hard to make it really special for the kids so I hope you all bring your children. Just for fun. Two stop signs up from allskate in jackson. Corner of north and Wayne.
These events are going to be just so much fun. Also help adopt children. To hopefully get AT LEAST one present to every little one that is not getting a present. 
I am also told that people has called the news papers,radio and news to see if they would be interested in sharing with us the community coming together to do something good for the children. 
I Hope to see a ton of children.

status_message: Wonderful that Applebee's honors and serves veterans with a meal on Veterans Day, but having "made in China" American flags on the table was a fail.

Thank you, Applebee's, for your patriotic decorations, your Missing Soldier Table of Honor, your free meal for my husband, your free desserts previously purchased by patrons for Veterans on Veterans Day. Thank you for being part of what makes America great! When we had lunch yesterday, your establishment was PACKED with Vets and their families. The bar was full of Vets that came to eat by themselves, but not alone. The staff was especially gracious and helpful, and the gesture was excellently executed. You're a class act in our book. 
With gratitude, 
Michelle Hawkins

Thanks to Applebee's  for another great Veteran's  Day dinner.  Food was great along with the service.

This is so true. Today we went out to Applebee's for lunch. Prior to being seated we were asked "How many Vets?" and I said just 1, me. We were promptly seated. When it was time to order I had the "Vet" menu in front of me & our server (a woman) asked if we were ready to order. I started to order from the Vet menu & the server RUDELY told me that was for the veteran. I told her I am the veteran & all she said was, "oh well the host didn't say." There was no "I'm sorry" just the blame passed. I was offended. I served our country honorably until I was injured. To have a server assume that the man in our group was the vet was sexist & disrespectful. Better sensitivity training will go a LONG way to keep service staff from ignorance offending patrons.
Daddy/Daughter Veteran's Day dinner out. Thanks Applebee's for the complimentary meal and support of all veterans and active duty personnel.

status_message:
Help a soldier and his family out this Veterans Day.
Im a medic in the Army National Guard, and I almost lost my wife and unborn daughter in September. My wife was hospitalized with congested heart failure due to peripardom cardio myopathy and only 10% of her heart was functioning.
They did an emergency c-section and my daughter, Hailey, was in the NICU as she had trouble breathing on her own. She was released after a week and is doing fantastic now!
My wife, Jill, was in the hospital for a month and they did a few different procedures. She was discharged and now her heart is 20% efficient. She still has a very long journey with lots of follow up appointments. 
My medical platoon started a fund to help us with all the expenses as it will be very expensive. Every dollar donated helps the cause. Please donate what you can and pray for a full recovery for my best friend, my wife.
Donate At

The COVER PHOTO!
When you promote your ad/s on facebook people using mobile devices can't see them, mobile devices is the most widely used method for going on facebook worldwide.

wouldn't it be good for your company or business?

So after a late day of school shopping I took my wife and kids to Applebee's in Fayetteville, NC tonight. I'm not quite sure what to say about how disappointed I was. Apparently Applebee's now has karaoke on Wednesday nights here. So there I was in what I thought was a family restaurant listening to inappropriate rap songs and watching highly suggestive videos on the largest screen in the restaurant. Bear in mind my daughters are 11 and 14, listening to curse words and watching almost naked women twerking or being dry humped on this big screen. I counted six curse words over the course of three songs. While not a big deal in a nightclub where it's to be expected, definitely not something I expect in a family establishment. Not to mention the fact that the music was so loud we literally couldn't hear each other talking. When I addressed my concerns with the manager, he stated this wasn't his restaurant, that he was just filling in. He stated he would talk to the dj and that his restaurant doesn't allow this type of vulgar music. Just curious Applebee's is this how you want your restaurants to be portrayed? I would think that you as an establishment would be better than this.

Went to the Applebees in Latham NY today around 530. I ordered steak medium done. It was so dry so i asked for another one medium. Tiny bit of pink. I got a RARE steak. It wasnt even warm in the middle! Absolutely disgusting. The garlic mash was gross too. It didn't taste like it should have. Ive had them multiple times and they were good. status_message:
Together we can create "A story with millions of your own adventure in it". 
Hi there.
Do you ever read a very boring fiction?
Do you ever feel that you can easily guess the storyline?
Do you ever feel that the main character had made a mistake when making decisions?
Do you ever feel that the end of the story does not match your expectations?
Do you ever feel that you can make a better ending?
Do you ever feel that you can make a fictional story better than the story you are reading?
If one or all of the above answer is yes, then you can join us.
Together we can create "A story with millions of your own adventure in it". 
A story with millions of your own adventure in it - looking for readers, writers, ghost writers, authors, editors, reporters, journalists, bloggers, influencers, entrepreneurs, sponsors (funders) like you who want to help by giving $ 1 or more and spreading this campaign and the story to the world. 

With one dollar or more you can create a new entertainment industry and change the way you read a story. 
And every dollar you give to support this campaign I will return with perks worth tens, hundreds or even thousands of times.
This is a new entertainment industry you must know.
Try to imagine this. When you're reading a story on the website, you are given two choices. You can choose the next story based on your own choice. After selecting then you can continue reading the story. Shortly afterwards you will be presented back to the 2 other options. The next choice is up to you. Then you continue the story you are reading. After that you will be faced again with 2 choices. So onwards.

If you feel curious then you can re-read the story by changing your selection. Then you will see a different story with the story that you have read previously. The question now is why is this so? Because the storyline will be varying according to your choice. 


You might say like this. Sounds like a book "choose your own adventure". Books I read when I was young. Gamebooks are sometimes informally called choose your own adventure books or CYOA which is also the name of the Choose Your Own Adventure, a series of children's books published by Bantam Books. 
Correctly. The idea is taken from there. My story is the development of gamesbook. But I wrote a story much more interesting than the gamesbook because due to the limited number of pages. When a child first you may already feel interesting. But if you re-read the book now then becomes no fun anymore because you don't get anything with the amount of 80-200 pages. 
Choose your own adventure books or CYOA is evolving. CYOA evolved into MYOA or Millions of Your Own Adventure. Dont leave your friends behind. So  invite your friends to join us.
I, as the author (with your help) is planning to make tens of thousands of articles with millions of your own adventure in it. With tens of thousands of articles then you like to see a show of your favorite series on TV for several years. 
The difference is while watching your favorite TV series, then you can not change the story. Meanwhile, if you read this story then you can alter the way the story according to your own choice.
A story that I make (with your help) will surprise the world as made up of tens of thousands of articles with millions of your own adventure in it.
You are the main character in the story you are reading. So life and death, blessing and cursing, from the main character in the hands of you. 

With millions of your own adventure in it then you can be whatever you want according to the choice you make. 

You can be an entrepreneur. You can also become criminals. You can be a politician. You can be a pastor. You can also become a ghostbuster. So you become a success or a loser, it all depends on the choices you make.

Are you going to feel fun or cry, all depending on your choice. 

A good story can make us fun or cry, or make us discuss and argue with one another, because we can relate. A good story can help us see things in a new way. A good story can entertain us, enlighten us, and it can change us.
read more : https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/9ab70bcc#/story
This campaign was active on August 8, 2015.

First, I realize I should have made complaints last night while I was in the actual restaurant but I was frustrated with the quality and taste of food and poor service and tired. My cousin, her kids, and I were trying to find some place after 9 last night to eat. We see the billboard advertising half price apps after 9 and thought let's give it a try. No where on the billboard does it specify it is only CERTAIN apps you get half priced. We get there, I order the bar appetizer of pickles. I understand the bar apps are going to be smaller than regular apps but only 7 pickles is pathetic. The flavor was good, however, some were mushy instead of crisp. Next I try to order my entree, the steak something or other hand-held. First on the list of hand-helds and was told they were out of the meat. Out of the meat on a Friday night. That's not a good sign. I tell waitress to put in everyone's orders while I decide on something else. Not once were we told only certain apps were half price and we went in thinking it was all. We only figured it out when we heard her tell the table behind us and the sloppy hand marked items in the menu. Poorly done. I decided to go with the salsa Verde nachos as my entree. They bring it out and there are chunks of iceberg lettuce all over it. Not strips chunks. Maybe five pieces of meat. Looked nothing like the photograph and was mediocre at best. I had to ask for a refill on water that was obviously empty. She brings it and sees the other water at the table is also empty. Does she ask if she needs a refill? No, my cousin has to ask. Also, one of the kids ordered a wrap with no bacon, comes with bacon. The four cheese macaroni, looked and according to what I was told, taste like barely one cheese. The waitress did make an attempt to make that right by bringing out an extra bowl of cheese for the macaroni. I think one time out of all the times I've tried Applebee's it has been good but every other time, does nothing but disappoint. The food never looks like the pictures and the service is always pitiful.

From following the posts on Applebee's Facebook page today I had been led to believe EACH person could get 1 free appetizer sampler of each. However, at the location on Stratford Rd. in Winston Salem, you are only allowed 1 appetizer sampler of each (Sriracha Shrimp and S'mores Churros) per PARTY. Applebees:
As President of NAMI Rensselaer County who provides free support to Veterans families and Vets themselves (NAMI Homefront program, Peer to Peer, and Support Groups) this is very distressing.
I would like to present your side of the concern to our group and our vets and have this resolved PRESENTLY. We take our time and volunteer our time to support our vets with our own money and have mentioned your program, but have ceased noting Applebees until resolved. Please indicate actions are being taken.
Paul Klein www.namirensco.org. namirensco@gmail.com

I was in the Lynwood Washington store tonight to celebrate a friend's 21st Birthday (she was turning 21 at midnight). 

When we got there we explained this to our waitress, who was then shown her ID. There did not seem to be a problem with it, at that time.

When 12am came and we ordered drinks, we were told she could not be served until the next business day. I knew this was wrong and asked to speak to the manager. In talking with the manager he informed me that they are trained to do this and tried telling me it was the Law. I explained that I have worked in the industry for decades, and that was not in the Law.

We ended up having to leave.  Luckily for us, the next place we went knew the Law, and served her her first legal drink, no thanks to Applebee's.

Needless to say, we won't be doing business with Applebees ever again.

By the way, here's the Law as described by Seattle Police.  You might like to teach your managers the Law, and not let them lie to their customers. And if you are training them in this manner, please stop, you nearly ruined a close friends 21st Birthday.

Idiots!

A: Seattle Police Department spokesman Drew Fowler consulted the state Liquor Control Board in clarifying the answer.

Basically, he said, a person is of legal drinking age at the stroke of midnight on his or her birthday.

In other words, if your birthday is on the 20th, you can spend the evening of the 19th being responsible and drinking celebratory tea (thats what people do, right?) until midnight, when you can begin your law-abiding drinking of adult beverages.
link_name: How soon can you start drinking when you turn 21?

So I went to Applebee's today for lunch and I was very  dissatisfied. I ordered the 4 cheese Mac n cheese with the honey glazed chicken tenders and this is what I received. Now, I've had this plate  several times within the last 3 months, but never have I've ever received chicken bites that were suppose to be "chicken tenders". So they basically threw chicken bites or chicken nuggets on top of my dish. So naturally I call the manager over and this is what he brings me (2nd photo to follow post) to correct the size of the chicken bites that were presented as chicken tenders. I am a frequenter visitor of Applebee's but after today I'm not sure if I shall take my business elsewhere. I can on longer about how long the service was for us to get our food because "the cooks messed up several orders so our dishes will take longer than usual" at least that's what the waitress told us. Then the Women's restroom was totally and completely filthy. I can go on forever . This was at the Bayshore Town Center location in Milwaukee, Wi. I am highly disappointed in the entire restaurant after today.

I noticed my posting has been removed from both the corporate and Fort Wayne Village of Coventry Applebees facebook pages. 

I notice the Fort Wayne Village of Coventyr took my posting down.

If there is any debate internally as the Village of Coventry Applebees contends whether  there should be a difference between Cross-cut ribs and Riblets I refer you to the press release below. If there is still question ask Mr. Dugan.

Cut to a size that makes them more snackable than Applebees traditional Riblets
Were thrilled to push the envelope and introduce new flavorful and tender Crosscut Ribs, said Darin Dugan, Applebees Senior Vice President of Culinary and Marketing.

August 18, 2014
Applebees, Americas favorite neighborhood grill and bar, is reinventing an American classic with the introduction of Crosscut Ribs, a new street cuisine-inspired, no-utensils-necessary way to devour the most tender, meaty bone-in cuts of pork loin the brand has ever offered.
image: http://mms.businesswire.com/media/20140818005192/en/428083/4/crosscut-ribs-low-res.jpg
 
Applebee's new Crosscut Ribs feature the most tender, meaty bone-in cuts of pork loin, tossed in new handcrafted sauces. (Photo: Business Wire)
Cut to a size that makes them more snackable than Applebees traditional Riblets or Baby Back Ribs, Crosscut Ribs are best eaten by hand (with plenty of towelettes at the ready!) after being slow-cooked and slathered with one of three original Applebees sauces: new Sweet Asian Chile, new Smoky Chipotle or classic Honey BBQ.
	Sweet Asian Chile: Applebees sweet, spicy sauce with the flavors of soy, ginger, red chile and garlic.
	Smoky Chipotle: A sweet sauce infused with the smoky flavors of chipotle and ancho peppers.
	Classic BBQ: The sweetness of honey meets the classic taste of BBQ.
Were thrilled to push the envelope and introduce new flavorful and tender Crosscut Ribs, said Darin Dugan, Applebees Senior Vice President of Culinary and Marketing. You pair these ribs with one of our new sauces and its such an unbeatable combination, you dont want to be the last person to try them.
For a limited time, Applebees Guests can try all three delicious sauces with All-You-Can-Eat Ribs, served with new crispy BBQ-spiced fries and creamy coleslaw, and share their rave reviews using the hashtag #CrosscutRibs on social media.
Perfect Swigs for Each Round of Ribs
As the summer season winds down, Applebees rounds out its bar offering with a new lineup of cocktails featuring popular drinks perfect for kicking off fall and rib-eating season. These drinks put a modern twist on the classics and are handcrafted to satisfy every palette.




Thank You,

I went to your Amherst location on Niagara Falls Blvd today for the 3rd time, figuring i'd give it another chance.  Everytime I have ordered takeout here, I've been disappointed.  This time takes the cake.  There was no heat and there were electric heaters all over the place.  I was told the heat had been broken since Saturday.  I ordered a green goddess wedge salad to go.  The picture below shows what I received.  A wedge of BROWN, mushy lettuce with strips of bacon on it.  I've ordered this in the restaurant before to eat in and never had an issue.  Everytime I order take out, the food is terrible.  It's obvious the kitchen and staff doesn't care about your takeout customers.  I'm done with this location as my complaints to management there before have obviously fallen on deaf ears.  Please do something about this so nobody else has to waste their money and be given garbage.  Very unhappy.

I am a food critic my review is up on Fauquier Foodie FB page for Applebees in warrenton VA. to let the community know my experience there this afternoon. Hopefully management will go in and sort this place out before they poison someone.  
Review of Applebees in Warrenton VA.
I won't bother putting up pictures it was a disaster. My little boy had a rough day at school, and wanted to go somewhere to eat so, we popped in there as it is close by, and on the way home. It is also meant to be half price for kids on Tuesday, and being kids they often just want chicken nuggets and corn dogs. The wait staff were fine seated us on a table that wobbled. The crowd at the bar were already drunk at 3:30 pm in the afternoon, and we could here the F bomb being shouted where we sat by the window, on the rocking table 20 feet away. They have a new pub menu, I ended up ordering a drink and an appetizer of mini sliders. The kids ordered chicken nuggets and fries, and the corn dog & fries. It took a while for the food to come out, when it did the corn dog was frozen. The manager came by and apologized and they said they would be out with another soon. The second round came out and yes again the corn dog was frozen in the middle. Manager came by again apologized had nothing to really say for the fact the cooks can't cook. They took my daughter's kids meal off the bill still charged me full price for mine and my sons. I won't be back and again this reiterates to me the poor standards of chain restaurants in our area. I'll be letting Applebees know. My advice stay clear.

Today, I ordered online through Applebee.com's website and purchased an order for takeout. Needless to say, my photos show how the food really is when it's served to you in "real life" versus the misrepresentation reflected in the photos of their food on their website.
For lack of better words, I am deeply disappointed and would not come back to this Applebee's location again, and possible never again to Applebee's period.
In brief, my steak was cold and undercooked (completely pink in the inside, although I put in my order to have it well-cooked with a HINT of pink). Likewise, the stuffed mushroom was very watery and, again, cold. My salad was disgusting....just look at it yourself. Does this look appetizing?! The chefs usually real Grade A bagged salad mix......I sure feel that I got my whole $11.49's worth!
Lastly, as shown below, I ordered one "Strawberry cheesecake shooter" and one "Hot fudge sundae shooter"; however, this is not what was included in my order (see below). Secondly, I asked for whipped cream for both, yet I got only one small container for the two desserts and the whipped cream was already melted and about the same consistency as soup by the time of when I arrived at the restaurant.
This is a horrible experience and if this is a direct reflection of the new Applebee's, BOY have they sure gone down hill!
