I love you guys, so this is not intended to be a direct hit, BUT my current location (Picayune, Mississippi) is terrible. This was a Carside-To-Go order that was supposed to be well done...it was bloody. This happens so often that we are getting to the point where we just don't want to waste our money there anymore.

Yesterday I posted an item about my friend Denise, formerly of Applebeesit told the story of how I first met Denise under not the best of circumstances and how that meeting resulted in a continuing friendship that has been very helpful to me and to my objectives of promoting Junes memory and honor as well as the closely related objectives of Alzheimers awareness, research, funding and care practicesit has also been a very personally satisfying friendship without any bumps in the road..

It was gratifying to me to see how the readers of my comments would reactthey are ALL very positive and agree that Denise was something special and an angel on earth

The responses were literally world wide (Africa, England, Scotland, Ireland, Germany and coast to coast) and for the most part reflect comments of care givers past and present or victims of Alzheimers or one of the dementia diseasesone was from my sister in law Lynda in Rice Lake, WI and the last one was from my Nephew Jauhn in Green Bay, WI who said he loved it

Of course there is always that segment of readers who say nothing

I am passing the comments on to Denise so that she can also see how loved she is by everyone

Reader Comments

Mandie Yates - Birmingham, United Kingdom - 18 January 2015): "What a sweetie...thank you for sharing...we do indeed all need a Denise now and again."

Susu Ibie  -Benin City, Nigeria - (18 January 2015):"God bless you Denise. It is always refreshing to know that there are still some very special human beings you can count on. Thanks for all your help to Stanton."

Martina Kaut  - Furtwangen, Germany - (18 January 2015): "Wow ... she is truly * an Angel* ... thank you for sharing this with us, Stan."

Billy Thomson  - Edinburgh, Scotland - (18 Janaury 2015) "Great stuff...dementia needs good friends like this lady bless her ."

Vicki Cadogan  -Limerick, Ireland - (18 January 2015): "Sounds like a fantastic lady Stan, bet ye had some interesting debates."

Ursula Zarecki Sypniewski - Toms River, New Jersey - (18 January 2015):"Definitely a great friend! What a kind and generous woman."

Susan Kimball  - Dover, Pennsylvania - (18 January 2015):"So sweet."

Catherine Jones-Hatcher  - Richmond, Virginia -(18 January 2015): "We should all be so lucky to have such a friend!"

Lin Schmidt  - Anoka, Minnesota - (18 January 2015):"What an awesome person she is!"

Lisa Dowis Blackmore - Swansea, Illinois - (18 January 2013):"May God continue to bless you and Denise! Love this story that shows there are still good people in this upside down world."

Mary Ayers -Madison, Alabama - (18 January 2015):"There still are kind thoughtful people out there. May she also be helped in her time of need...Glad you're feeling better, Stan."

John Stevens -Twin Falls, Idaho - (18 January 2015):"Wow. That warmed me all over. Renews my faith in the younger generation. Sweethearts like this don't grow on trees. God makes them."

Marla Wise Miller -Bremen, Indiana - (18 January 2015) "One of those 'earth bound' Angels, indeed."

Marsha McKneely Ault  - Nacogdoches, Texas - (18 January 2015):"There is still good in this ole world. Thank you Denise for watching over our friend, Stan."

Patrice Kohn - McKinney, Texas - (18 January 2015):"What a delightful & true friend Denise must be. You are both blessed to have each other in your lives. So glad you're feeling better Stan. God bless you both!"

Donna Dischert Blake - Havertown, Pennsylvania - (18 January 2015): "An angel."

Denise Specht Quesnell - Merced, California - (18 January 2015): "What an awesome person you have in your life, I enjoyed reading your emails on June's page. Everyone should be so lucky."

Lynda Etlicher - Rice Lake, Wisconsin - (19 January 2015): "Yes I think Denise is a. Good friend. The kind you should hang onto. We all need them."

Arlinda Lynch - New York, New York (19 January 2015):"I remember your story about Denise from a little while ago about her making the plaque above you and June's favorite booth at Applebees. It always sticks out in my mind. I love hearing stories about such good people. It doesn't take much to just be good and live a good life, but sometimes it does seem hard to find. Glad you have found someone so special!"

Cindy Ellis - Minneapolis, Minnesota - (19 January 2015): "The world needs more people like her."

Jauhn Etlicher - Green Bay, Wisconsin - (19 January 2015):"LOL-love it! What a special person Uncle Stan!

What does your company CEO have to say about this!!!
As we ring in the New Year, share with us your favorite memory from 2014. #NewYearsEve

*Both Allie and I were longtime employees of the Newtown, PA Applebee's. Hoping for some support here.. thank you all for your donations, likes, and shares!!

A friend very dear to my heart lost her fiance on Nov 26th, 2014. Her name is Valerie Fee, though she prefers Allie/Mom. She is 31 years old, lives in Quakertown, PA has two amazing children, Julianna, 8 and Frankie Jr., 3. 
In an unexpected moment we all pray to never have to experience, she has instantly gone from a happy-go-lucky stay at home mom to a widow, who now has to make a million ends meet while instantly filling both parental roles. She is also the type of person who through life experience,  typically doesn't ask for help. I see a million of these type of fundraisers based off of people trying to raise money for a variety of awesome goals, usually functions that one like myself could never afford - and by all means I am not trying to take away from that - but I feel like this cause is far more important than any civic event.. We're just a few days before Christmas as we start this, and I am asking anyone that has ever known me, or does know me.. If you can give ANYTHING, please, consider it the most flat out purchase of karma you've ever come across. I have never known anyone dealt a more difficult hand in life, only to be determined make the best of it and give her kids better, and finally in turn losing her partner and love of her life so early in their kids lives.. May your generosity come back to you in your moment of tribulation, and God bless you. Thank you from the bottom of my heart, regardless of denomination. I know every dollar helps her and her beautiful children. Merry Christmas and Happy holidays to you all, and God Bless!
link_name: Click here to support Paying forward: Instant Karma! by Beck Gregory

This was posted to the Go Go Squeeze website. Please stop supporting Go-go squeeze and take them off of your kids menu NOW!! Mold is being found in these and kids are being hospitalized bc is it. Gogo squeeze is being uncooperative with people and hanging up the phone on people who complain and deleting comments on their Facebook page. Go to their Facebook page at click on Posts to Page and read all the comments! It's crazy how many kids are getting sick, how many packages are tainted, and how much Go-Go Squeeze doesn't care! Please take these off of your kids menu to prevent anymore kids from getting sick!! Thank you

I have not had good service in any Applebee's since maybe 1993. Tonights summary: 14min from being sat to getting greeted by server. 28min to receive app. 36min to receive entrees. 48min to receive the soup portion of the entree. Only 12min from receiving check to getting change. Total Applebee's dining experience!? 1 hour and 15min. AND look at the place...it's NOT busy. I do like the french onion soup though! Friends always ask why we go there and I tell them there are some things on the menu we love and we expect bad service in which they always give free food....without us even complaining! We just sit there and take the abuse....and they always dish out a cheap bill.

Dinner at Applebee's Marshall,  MI location. Advertisement on my table clearly stated if the manager of this store does not visit your table during your visit redeem a 5 dollar gift certificate. Not only did the manager not visit my table but after receiving my 5 dollars gift certificate. After reading the card it is only redeemable at locations in Detroit/Grand Rapids and Lansing. The closest Applebee's in any direction to these cities is more than an hour away. Let's just say I will not be using this certificate and I will not be going back to the location here in Marshall. My experience and 20 other that agree per my Facebook comments about the quality of As they named crapplebees. 

On the way home from the horse show we decided to place a Togo order with Applebee's because they offer curbside Togo.  (I had no right to go in public after the show) 

Phillip placed the order online at 6:24 pm. The website allowed a choice of inside or curbside pickup and the receipt clearly shows he choose curbside.

Having been a sever, I know Saturday nights are busy and I made one other stop before going to the restaurant. 

By the time I arrived at the restaurant, there was another vehicle in one of the Curbside slots. The body language of these people suggested they were agitated and I assumed the to go host was a little slow with their order. 20 more minutes passed before the other passenger stormed into the store and returned with her order. By this point her body language read "angry."
 
At 7:15 I decided to go in to check on my order. The host told me that to go orders are part of the bar's duties. 
(I admit, I was a bit upset at this point.) 
I walked to the bar and informed the tender that I'd placed my order almost an hour earlier and it still hadn't been brought out. She informed me that the store does not offer Curbside service on weekends. So, I asked if the store had a means of informing customers about this detail since our order clearly had Curbside marked. Her response was, "Well, if you called in the order, you would have known."

Now, I was really fighting to not lose my cool. As I said, I used to be a server, and I'm really good at biting my tongue. According to the receipt, I got the food at 7:21 and I promptly left. (Because of the online payment, the bar tender already had a 15% tip.)
 
When I got home, it was clear the food had sat under a heat lamp for 30 minutes. Also, I had ordered a salad, which they tossed the dressing on before placing under the lamp. (Yummy, soggy salad.)

Phillip ordered a steak, cooked medium, and paid $1.49 extra for mushrooms. If you take a peek at the pictures, you can see what awaited us when we opened the boxes.  

#applebees #restaurants #poorservice

link_name: Hey Applebees: We're Celiacs...We're Not Psychotic

status_message: Because its #NationalBrownieDay, thats why.
Applebee's, what were you thinking by calling your guest PSYCHOTIC?  You have now lost the faith of the entire celiac/gluten-free community!

For everyone who wanted to see the full picture of the receipt..I marked the card info and the signature. It clearly says merchant copy. This is a photo copy of the receipt cause this is what they gave us

Pretty sad....these ppl don't  get it!!! For a Celiac when glutened it means days of throwing up and running to the bathroom every hour. Especially hurtful for a mother of a child with Celiac when you tell the waiter that you want a hamburger without the bun and they bring it out with the bun. Not very easy dealing with your child after that...have some compasion!!!! It's  NOT a fad it really does make ppl sick, even for days later!!! So because of the waiters/waitresses out there who don't listen or take this seriously...YES we have to be PSYCHOTIC!!!!

This was shared on a celiac support group from your restaurant. This is horrible when a customer  wants to eat in your restaurant and your wait staff says they are psychotic because they do not want to get sick. I have celiac and I am gluten free. I do not go to your restaurant because you are not gluten free friendly and my experience was not a good one. This proves that I will never go to your restaurant because your policy on how to treat customers with food issues is a disgrace and you do not care if they get sick.When a customer special requests because of illness be respectful!!!!

Just read this on a group I'm in for people with Celiac Disease, something y'all apparently do not take seriously. I am so disgusted.. teach your servers that this is a REAL AUTOIMMUNE DISEASE and for some even a topical allergy! I bet if this was a peanut allergy y'all would take it a lot more seriously! Applebee's you need to fix this!

This is how Applebee's treat celiac people. They call them psychotic. I personally have not and will not ever eat at Applebee's since my diagnosis of celiac disease because when I went there they were rude but this happened to a fellow celiac and this is what they did? I hope Applebee's goes bankrupt!
Might want to educate your servers that autoimmune diseases and food allergies aren't a laughing matter. Would you make fun of someone with MS or diabetes??  You should do better!

We ate the rest of our food and I brought the tomato to our waitresses attention. I had no expectation for a refund, etc and the waitress (she was great) took my plate to the manager.  She returned several minutes later and said " The manager apologized".  What kind of customer service is that?  The manager can't come to our table and say a couple words himself on one of the slowest nights of the year?  Piss poor leadership for your employees!  There's about 25 other restaurants with a 3 mile radius of this Applebee's and customers are better off going elsewhere.

I also sent an email to the Contact Us link on the website, but the 1500 character limit just wasn't enough for the terrible visit we had (why put a limit on it anyways?  People need to clearly get information across.  I think communication is a HUGE issue in your stores, and this just proves why!)

Very disappointed in Applebees once again (Fort Wayne, IN Clinton Street).  My family of 5 went on 9-13.  I had a birthday coupon and wanted to try it out again, hoping things had changed.  

We waited over 30 minutes for our food, and it finally came after we asked for it.  Our server, Tanya C. was great, but the manager, Sheila, was terrible.  We asked Sheila about our food 30 minutes after we'd ordered, and she said it should only take about 15 minutes, and since it had been so long she'd check on it.  She left and never came back to tell us it would be so many minutes or to ask if it was ok once we got it.  

When we did get the food, it was COLD, lukewarm at best.  And it wasn't just one thing, everything was like this.  I had the onion steak (medium rare) with smashed crispy potatoes, sauteed mushrooms (supposed to be in a bowl on the side) and broccoli, husband had steak (medium rare) with mashed potato and baked potato, daughter 1 and 3 each had steak (one medium and one medium rare) with applesauce, daughter 2 had chicken fingers and french fries.  

In addition to being COLD, there were several other issues.  My steak came out without the potato or the onion, and it was cooked medium well.  Also the mushrooms were so salty (and cold) they were inedible.  They also came on the same plate as my steak, and I asked for them in a bowl on the side because I don't like the juice from my food running together.  My husband's baked potato was forgotten.  Daughter 1 steak was cooked very rare, like just seared and thrown on the plate.  

We asked to see the manager, as we were flabbergasted at all the issues.  I can understand one or two things being wrong, but this was the WHOLE MEAL.  We explained it and also explained that we didn't have time to wait *another* 30 minutes for our food.  My husband did eat his mashed potatoes and steak because he was starving after having worked all day and only had oatmeal for breakfast and a couple peanut butter sandwiches for lunch.  Daughter 1 ate her steak.  Everything else was left untouched.  

Sheila left with the check and came back and announced "I was able to get it down to $12 for ya, is that OK?" and smiled.  No, it's not ok, since the food was terrible, and we didn't eat it.  But whatever, I don't have time to argue.  I paid the $12 and we left the server a good tip because the service WAS good.  The food sucked!  And we did NOT take anything home.  Boxes weren't even offered until after the manager took the money off the bill, and saw how upset I was.  I wanted to make the point that the food was bad.  Hopefully it worked.  

I had to stop at McDonalds on the way home and spent $14 on food there because my kids and I were hungry.  I should not have to stop at another restaurant on the way home from a restaurant because the food was so bad we couldn't eat it.  We had a 25 minute drive from McDonald's to home, and the food was HOTTER from McDonalds when we got home than it was at Applebee's when we were there!  

Get it together Applebee's!  We have stopped coming because of crap like this.  This is the WORST visit we have ever had.  I really do want to use my birthday coupon, but at this point I'm wondering if I'll be able to.  

I have attached photos of the receipts to this post, showing that we were at Applebee's, and that we stopped at McDonald's 6 minutes after we paid our bill.

I traveled to Ocean City with my sister and her husband. I'm a widow. I recommended them to visit Applebees for lunch. They loved it, the food, the service, the cleanness. And I was disappointed, almost to tears. 
they ordered from the 2 for $20 menu the Bourbon Street Chicken & Shrimp. They liked it so much and the next time we came they insisted that I should order it as well, but from a regular menu. I checked the menu and was very disappointed - for the same Bourbon Street Chicken & Shrimp  and salad I would have to pay $20 for 1 person, when my sister has the same for $20 for 2.
It felt like discrimination for being without a partner. It was like another painful reminder about my loss.
Couldn't it be 2 for $20 or 3 for $30? It is hard to go to the restaurant alone, but when I'm going with friends, should I still be reminded that I can't have the same prices as a couple?
There is so many positive things in your restaurant, but a minor mistake can ruin everything.

Zach was so cool, I went up to him at his table and said "excuse me, you must be a famous HUSKER FOOTBALL PLAYER cause our waiter sure started ignoring us when he seen you here" lol,  Zach laughed and said, "No, I'm not Famous, but I am a HUSKER FOOTBALL PLAYER" What an honor to meet you Zach, you are Friendly, you have a wonderful smile, I read that you were on the Deans list, You mother and father must be VERY PROUD of you!!! Dear Applebees,

Since there is no email address provided for anyone in your company, and you don't respond to the web form you provide, or to snail mail, I'm posting here. I wish the world did not have to share in our conundrum -  but you've forced my hand...

Im writing to see if you received my complaint a few months ago outlining the concerns I had with my full order of ribs that I purchased for both myself and my son - who was home on leave from the United States Army at the time. I brought these concerns regarding our dinner to the manager on duty back in December, since then I've been eagerly awaiting a reply; from anyone 

(You can pre-record a cat talking and call me, at least then Ill know that my complaint was acknowledged, just please dont turn him into a baby back rib dinner afterwards, which I suspect is what my son and I tried to consume while last patronizing your establishment).

First, Id like a little clarification please if I may?

Please confirm which animal the ribs came from. I dont mean which animal specifically, just the species. I've thought about this long and hard and Im convinced they must have belonged to a cat, or one of the Olsen twins - probably Mary Kate.

To be honest, what was presented as a "meal" didn't hit the mark; not even close. I've seen meatier ribs in a World Vision Hunger commercial.

Your commercialism gives an impression of grandeur and quality regarding your food choices. You also appear to have a new slogan see you tomorrow. Because of this, I was expecting to be presented with a rack of ribs similar in size to the one that tips Freds car over during the opening sequence of The Flintstones. I also thought that perhaps I would dine with your establishment tomorrow.

Unfortunately, what I received looked more like Skeletors throne from He-Man and the Masters of the Universe - a childhood favorite cartoon of mine, although Skeletors throne was comparatively not burnt to a crisp and covered in BBQ sauce in order to hide that fact. His throne is also not using the bones of a small cat. I also did NOT dine in your restaurant tomorrow
 

Dont you think that for someone named Skeletor, hes incredibly muscular? 
Me too.

Remember the movie Gladiator, starring Russell Crowe? Its probably my favorite sports movie of all time. Basically, its about Rustys experience at the Coliseum. He gets really angry and kills lots of people in it, a scene Ive played out in my mind countless times over the last couple of months after thinking about my dining experience and my interaction with the manager and chef at my Applebees in Grants Pass. Dont worry though; Im not a violent person. At worst Id probably just throw a telephone at you - another one of Mr. Crowes favored combat techniques.

The one positive outcome from this experience is that Im thinking of sponsoring a World Vision Hunger child. I havent done much research into this yet - do I get to bring him home? If so, Id probably go for one with a bit of sweatshop and/or tailoring experience. Im terrible with a sewing machine, and since I lost so much weight - a consequence of meager rib consumption - I now require a skilled tailor to alter all my clothes. What do you think I should name the little guy? Im thinking, Maximus.

Im not after an apology, but I do want you to know that after the exorbitant amount of money I paid for the replica graveyard of bones and cobwebs covered in ut-oh BBQ sauce you gave us, could have been used to keep little Maximus and his family alive for a quarter of a millennium, which just happens to be the same amount of time itll take me to reconsider ordering from you again, especially after not hearing from you for so long, and being told in the restaurant I was going to pay for our meal regardless of MY determination of poor quality.

All the best,
Dan Richardson (and Maximus)

Went to your Union Gap location tonight, and I have to say, it was a pretty disappointing first experience with the Applebee's franchise. For $15, I was very underwhelmed by the "double barrel whiskey sirloin."

The steak was okay, but overcooked, and for being advertised as being topped with red pepper, mushrooms, and caramelized onions, I saw maybe three slices of mushroom, maybe 1/20th of an onion, and even less of a red pepper - certainly nothing like the picture displayed on your website (a "mountain" of garlic mashed potatoes? Seriously?). I was hoping to have a much better first time with your franchise... can't say I'll be going again, after this; for the money, there are just so many better local options.

This is the sadest thing I have ever seen. My son had his tonsils removed today and the only thing he wanted was Applebee's broccoli and cheese soup. We ordered 3 bowls. When my husband went to pick it up he was told they only had enough for 2. No one ever called to let us know or to ask if we wanted to order something else.  When I took the top off the bowl and saw that they weren't even half full, all I could think "that is one sad looking soup". There's not even a 1/2in of soup in these bowls.  I am very up set with what we received and even more upset with customer service when I called to voice my unhappiness.  I'm not sure if we will be back.
We make quite a pair.

I just wanted to share my experience at the Applebee's in Raytown, Missouri on Saturday night.  My girls decided to be goofy and wore some goofy outfits.  They are teenagers and have been having problems with some depression.  I decided to allow them to accompany us for a family dinner to this location to be good natured and supportive of them and their creativity.  Keep in mind, we generally go to this location once a week or at least bi-weekly (5-7 of us) and sit in the bar area where the kids sit at one table and my fianc, his brother and I sit at another table to smoke and that way it doesn't bother them.  We spend generally $60-$80 there and are friends with the server Dottie.  I normally participate in the surveys and give them excellent ratings, but the last 2 times we have gone have been a disappointment.  The second to the last time, we were told a 15 minute wait because there were no clean tables (not true, we could see clean tables).  Then the server (whom I felt took advantage of us being regulars said that she knew we would be patient while she got some of the tables their food, so the kitchen wasn't back logged with orders).  Finally, 45 minutes later we were seated.  This was the first weekend of May, so with the Cinco de Mayo specials a lot of the appetizers we order were sold out by the time we were seated.  Saturday when we went, we were told a 10 minute wait, once again no clean tables (again false), then the manager (whom I have spoke with several times and normally recognizes us) came and asked if at least one of us was over 21 (thank you for the compliment, however, I just turned 35 and you have carded me previously when I ordered margaritas).  I felt this was discriminatory because of the way my kids were dressed and this upset me.  Told another 10 minutes by the manager.  A few minutes later the bartender/server for the smoking area, told us another 15 minutes or so.  I assumed someone else would come out and tell us another 10-15 minutes the way it was going.  When we finally ordered and were situated, we heard the bartender/server getting upset with the dishwasher because she was the only server and bussing all the tables in the smoking area and the dishwasher was complaining about all the dishes she was bringing back.  She apologized for her outburst about the dishwasher.  This location in the last 2 month has had one fight that Dottie told us about and another fight outside the Carside to Go area that we were present for.  We always tip well, never cause any issues and yet, this is how you repay our loyalty?  We went to 54th Street Bar and Grill tonight, had excellent food, a 20 % off coupon, half price appetizers and drinks after 9 pm (same as you) and we were treated respectfully (this is also closer to my house).  So instead of doing YET another survey, where I may or may not get my crappy $10 gift card (I didn't get one when I complained about my wings being raw, but the manager-the same one that questioned if I was over 21-gave me the $10), we will probably just start going to 54th Street, where they are not understaffed, appreciate our business and don't have the unnecessary entertainment you have......Good luck keeping that location open....
God bless you :-)

I just had the loveliest evening with one of my top three WORST dining experiences ever. Starting off, it was really great to wait 40 minutes for a table, when this VERY same table has sat like this before, during, and after my arrival. When receiving our food, half the food was missing and we would be assured that they were "making the fries fresh". Half an hour later, I acknowledged it AFTER we finished our meal, and staff and management was nonchalant about it. I think the MOST frustrating part about this, wasn't for myself, but for the table next to us. They were seated a good 20 minutes before us, but we received and finished our food before they even got their appetizers. I'm actually still sitting at the table right now with zero offers of a drink refill, and a barren table for 20 more minutes (food---or the half I did received was finished then). Keep up the great job!

I encourage everyone to PLEASE SHARE THIS POST and help our Veterans!

 My name is Bryce Amdur, I am 26 Years old. I served nearly 5 years in the United States Army. I was Medically discharged in February 2013. I am Racing in the Spartan Race To show myself and other veterans that no matter what, We can and we will come back through the hell we have gone through. I am racing all 3 of the Spartan Race events throughout the year of 2014 in order to receive what they call the Trifecta Medal. I have teamed up with the Wounded Warrior Project in order to personally raise $100,000 Dollars for the WWP by the time I finish my Trifecta Challenge on October 25,2014 in Sacramento, California. I want to help the WWP in order to assist them in everything they do for our Veterans who return home with challenges from War. It is not an easy road and they need our support. Us as Americans need to be Thankful for our veterans and help them reintegrate back into civilian life. Please go to the link bellow and send whatever you can, weather it be $1, $5, $10 whatever you can to help me reach my goal and to help the WWP keep doing the amazing work they do for our War Veterans. 

 PLEASE SHARE, LIKE, COMMENT


 PLEASE HELP OUR VETERANS!

The average length of a hug between two people is 3 seconds. But researchers have discovered something fantastic. When a hug lasts 20 seconds, there is a therapeutic effect on the body and mind. The reason is that a sincere hug produces a hormone called "oxytocin", also known as the love hormone. This substance has many benefits in our physical and mental health, helps us, among other things, to relax, to feel safe and calm our fears and anxiety. This wonderful calming is offered free of charge every time we have a person in our arms, who cradled a child, we cherish a dog or cat, we're dancing with our partner, the closer we get to someone or just hold the shoulders of a friend.

Hello, my name is Nicholas Bishop I am 20 years old and a local from Youngstown Florida. I listen to you guys all the time and I wanted to send a message to share my story. I have a disease called Charcot-Marie Tooth disease which is characterized by loss of muscles tissue and touch sensation, predominantly in the feet and legs but also in the hands and arms in the advanced stages of the disease. This disease is not well known because it is rare but does effect 37 out of 100,000 people. The FDA does not support stem cell research in the United States which is why I need help in raising money so I can go to Mexico and have the treatment. Stem cell research is approved in Mexico and several other countries across the globe. I wanted to send you guys a message to help me raise the money I need by creating awareness over the radio and sharing my link to your audience. I know in life people come across hardships and challenges every day, but as a young man I am passionate about getting this disease known, not only to help myself but to help other people across the globe that are affected. Anything you could do would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you,
Nicholas Bishop
(317) 363-5679
7132 clayton Rd 
Youngstown, FL 32466
link_name: Click here to support Charcot-Marie Tooth Syndrome-Nick Bishop by Nicholas Ray Bishop

Andover KS Applebee's was the location 
This was the worst experience ever. We waited 20 minutes to get a drink order. Waited 30 minutes to get our appetizer. Then our food came out 20 minutes after that. Half of the food came out 5 minutes after everyone else's. A child's pizza meal was cold. My potatoes were rotten in my meal. The other adult was served the wrong meal entirely but still had to pay for it after we explained to the waitress and the manager STEVE that it was wrong. I showed STEVE the rotten potatoes and he looked at me and said "hmm. Sorry about that. " and I said well I need you to adjust our tickets accordingly. 3.00 off for my meal and 2.00 off the cold food and the wrong entree all together. Terrible. This needs to be made right if you value your customers and reviews.

I'm not using your web page "Contact us" form because I cannot attach the five photos, but this email has all your required information. Since your corporate email is not public, I have no choice but to post this your facebook page.
-----
First name:   Giovanni             Last name: Lo Bello
Email address: Mr_Gadget_Man@yahoo.com
Address: (Removed from facebook post.)
Birthday: NOT included since this communication does not involve the Internet.
Phone: (H) none,    (M) 347 386-9846

Restaurant information:
     United States of America, New York State, Fresh Meadows, 
     61-48 188th Street
Date of visit: January 26, 2014
Visit Details:
        Guests: 2                Server: Kimberly
        Time of visit: 09:05 pm
Manager visit table: NO

Issue:

The food tasted pretty good, but nothing special. The service was a little slow considering it wasn't that busy and Kimberly didn't seem too interested in being at work that night. She didn't even introduce herself.

No bread, or something to knosh on, was provided while we were waiting to order, or waiting for the food to arrive. It's a small gesture that says "Welcome, friends!" and "Tank you for patronizing our establishment." I'm not sure if it was an oversight on Kimberly's part, the manager's, or Applebees policy. I did not ask, but, admitedly, it felt unusual because all of the other restaurants I visit always provide something. I strongly believe it is a nice touch, and brings forth a sense of friendliness. No such feelings were felt at Applebees. The atmosphere was so cold we might as well have been in Alaska.

However, when time came for coffee I got a rather rude awakening: with TWO mugs of coffee we were each given TWO 1/2 ounce(?) creamer cups! Really? When I asked for more she bought over ONE container for EACH of us! The coffee hardly changed to the light color I like. I asked if this was the manager's policy, and she responded "yes." I asked for more creamer & ****eventually**** she bought over a hand full of creamer cups PLUS a small glass of milk. In the meantime the coffee cooled off and she NEVER asked to replace it with warm coffee. Bitchy move, don't you think? Yet, she expected a decent tip! Do you think that attitude made a loyal customer? I think not!

What nerve to charge $3.00 for a mug of coffee and only supply 1 oz of creamer per mug of coffee, and an attitude from your staff! Are you kidding me?

I understand Applebee's is an International company, and this complaint will not mean much and most likely ignored, but I want 
Facebook users to know how uncaring Applebee's is and what to expect from such a huge company.

Worse, on my way out I noticed some safety issues outside the restaurant. 1) a basement door is damaged but NO protection is afforded pedestrians. And, 2) on the other side of the building there is a molding  that is sticking out from the wall, but because of a barrier it doesn't present danger to pedestrians. Enclosed are copies of the photos I took that night.
==================
Even though I'm not using your "Contact us" form from your web page, I expect the following Privacy Policy to be adhered to.

Privacy Policy

Applebee's values you and respects your privacy. Your information will not be sold or rented to others. The information you provide will be used to better understand your preferences so we can serve you better, and to communicate with you about our menu, special promotions and services.

I'd like to complain about the terrible service that my coworkers and I received at the Applebee's on 2389 Lakeland Drive Flowood, MS 39208 on January 26, 2014. My coworkers and I work in retail, so we know how to treat customers, unfortunately our waiter, who's name on the receipt is Kristopher C, did not. It took him 15 minutes to take our drink orders, then about 35 minutes to take appetizer orders then when we asked if we could finally order food and if there was a problem (he was short with us and rude from the moment we sat down) he blew up on us. He began to yell at us, told us that we were rude, and how I waved menu in his face as if he "wasn't even a human being". When we called the manager over, I believe her name is Camrien, she said that he would be pulled from the floor tonight and no longer working, even though he was still working by the time we left, but while she was talking to us Kristopher was yelling at our table from the opposite side of the restaurant, he was also complaining about how he has 3 other tables, but isn't that a waiters job? To work multiple tables at once? I'm so dissatisfied with the service and management at this location that I never want to eat at ANY Applebee's anywhere. I don't believe that this issue has been taken car of so I'm writing this to you guys so that you could take care of it. Here's a picture of my receipt.

So I was at my local Applebee's for dinner with my bf, Daniel Mc Dougal. I ordered their new menu item called the 4-cheese Mac & cheese with chicken strips. I have ordered this in the past and it was served to me with UN-COOK bacon! It was replaced during that visit and the item was taken off my bill. I decided to try it again with the hopes that it would be good like the replacement was. Low-and behold, it was once again served with UN-COOKED bacon. When I showed the manager he achknowleged the bacon was not cooked, quickly took the plate with the promise of a freshly cooked meal. I wasn't hungry anymore and had the meal boxed up.

When I received my bill the total was over $27.00. 

Here is the breakdown:

2 for $24
2 iced teas $2.99 ea
% discount -$4.80
1 Mac & Cheese discount -$11.99

If you do simple math and add it up the total comes to $13.19 BEFORE tax. If you add sales tax (9%) you come to a total of $14.38!!!! But yet the total came to OVER $27!!! Wth!?!? So I asked for the manager and he came over and argued with me that the bacon WAS cooked and that he had to charge me for another meal and only discounted the one meal!!! I told him that wasn't acceptable since I wasn't able to eat the replacement meal. He said that he would adjust the discount further. The picture attached is what he adjusted the bill which STILL doesn't add up correctly!!! Please everyone look at this and check it out!!! Please tell me if I'm wrong!!!

Anyone living in the Mesa area...... Applebees is hosting a fundraiser on Friday at the Higley Rd. and Brown Rd. location. If you go there to eat anytime from 11am till closing and mention Doug Hockers name they will donate 10% of your bill to him. He was paralyzed from the waist down in a terrible accident and we are trying to raise money to send him to a rehab center in California which we found thru the Christopher Reeves foundation. Project Walk may be able to retrain the nerves in his legs and he may be able to walk again. Or it would at least improve what he has now. This is not covered by insurance and we need to raise $40,000.00 to send him there. So if you can, treat yourself to a great meal at Applebees and help us reach our goal. Thank you so much.

status_message: Thought I would share.  Applebee's was kind enough to open their suite at Joe Louis Arena in appreciation of Veterans. Dear applebees... I have never had the service like I did on the night of October 9 2013. This was absolute garbage. I have been going to applebees consistently for the past 8 yrs at least once a month. I even have my bday parties there with at least 20 to 40 people every yr. I am usually at 59th ave and Peoria, 99 and northern, 75th and Bell rd, or rural rd and Broadway. Me and my soon to be wife decided to stop here at this applebees (bell canyon pavillions on I 17 and bell rd). We get a table and order a beer....   And wait.... And wait... And wait.... Finally we get our beers 20 mins later. We drink those and order another.... And wait and wait and wait.... 15 mins later we got the beers. Then we had no menus and were wanting food. When she finally came around again our beers had been gone for at least 10 mins. Me and my girl decided were not eating so I asked for a check. And wait and wait and wait... I was about to walk out and say applebees can eat this bill. But my girl did not let me. So finally the bill comes around and I pay and don't ask me why the hell I left a tip but I did. This was the worst experience I have ever encountered at applebees. Me and my girl were going out to eat tonight I asked her where? Her reply.. not applebees. Now I would never even take my time to wright this out but it bothers me knowing it bothered her. Just thought u should know.

status_message: This young man is missing, please show all employees nationwide.

Hey Applebee's just want you to know that I agree with what this location did.  Here is the comment I left: No Applebee's did not over react. Children of this age should be home in bed at 10pm and not up, least of all in a restaurant. When my daughter was that age and I took her to a restaurant she behaved, and when she started getting restless because she was bored, I took her home - kids don't find sitting around talking at a table fun. I sure hope Applebee's does not cave and pay these people off. I hope they are reading these comments and are embarrassed by their self entitlement.

Last Friday night I went out with a bunch of friends to Applebees. I ordered shrimp lemon fettuccine, no tomatoes. After having to tell the waitress once about the tomatoes, she brought me back what I thought was a new plate, but instead they just stirred everything up to make it look like there weren't any tomatoes. Thank goodness I am not allergic to them. After telling the waitress a second time I was told they were making me a brand new plate. A few seconds later of sifting through my current plate I came across whats pictured in the photo. This piece of metal is about 1 1/2 inches long  the way it currently sets, and I barely noticed it wrapped up in the pasta. It's a good thing I had to pick at my food. I will never eat at Applebees again. Could you imagine if this had gotten stuck in my teeth, tore my mouth, or if it had actually made it down my throat? And of course all I got from the management was a half-assed apology while they tried to get the piece of metal out of my hands. I was offered a free dessert and my meal comped, but after having been served this I wont eat another thing at your restaurants and I will be sure to pass this around for others to see. Oh and yes I have already emailed the company, but I think this should be posted here as well.

John Wayne, Celebration for 2nd career Grand Slam, 2013 SLYB Fall Ball, 8-25-2013

We want to say a BIG thank-you to our neighborhood Applebee's on Nicholasville Road! Our son, John Wayne, who plays for South Lexington Youth Baseball, declared a long time ago that Applebee's is his favorite restaurant. We began the tradition of visiting Applebee's whenever he gets a home run.  It all began at one game when as he was going up to bat, I told him from behind the fence at home plate that we'd "...go to Applebee's...now DO IT!" He did it--a homerun--and the tradition was born. Thereafter, at many more up to bats, his teammates from the dugout would chant "Applebee's, Applebee's, Applebee's" to encourage him on. His 5th homerun was hit and celebrated at Applebee's during the spring season this past May. The Applebee's staff was incredible making our celebration a great one. Today at our first Fall Ball Season game with "Applebee's, Applebee's, Applebee's" echoing from his SLYB Black Stallion teammates in the dugout, he achieved his 2nd career GRAND SLAM! We, of course, had to visit our most favorite Applebee's! We had our table visited by the restaurant manager, he was congratulated by our great server, was high-fived by the bartenders, and was served a celebratory ice cream. Thanks so much, everyone at Applebee's on Nicholasville Road, for celebrating with us! Hope to be back SOON!

So we ordered the 7 OZ. HOUSE SIRLOIN. 

Described as: "A petite version of our classic sirloin. Served with seasonal vegetables and your choice of garlic mashed potatoes or baked potato." 

And this is what we got: 7 OZ. Piece of Meat. 

I would describe it as: A piece of meat. Served with oh so fresh seasonal vegetables toped with the plastic wrap they came in! Including the price sticker which reads; $2.99. Garlic mashed potatoes? No. Baked Potato? Nope. Quick french fries. 

Thanks guys.

WTF is wrong with you guys? This make your dieticians look like amateurs and their supervisors look like idiots. When are you going to get it through your skulls that wheat products contaminate anything they contact? Including oil!

Fix your menu - get the three remaining appetizer items off of there.

Eat there at least once a week &  its always great. Ordered  curb side on my way home &  & it took 10 min to order. Then waited for another 15 in the parking lot for the food  *however, guy came to get my CC immediatly, but did not return with it for another  8 min & 15  on top of that for the food. Not only did they get my order completely wrong but I  didnt check it till I  got home, changed & ready for movie night . Called them, they said to bring all the food back , i did &  waited for another 10 min  after my second drive of 10 min. The manager quickly came out appologizing for the wait, took my returned food  & agreed it was the wrong order & never saw him again. He did replace my salad but  it was still not the one I ordered The Greek Goddess salad & this was their 2nd attempt. Not to mention the 2 nd attempt at making a specific burger w/o mushrooms that was also a fail. Never got an appology, but he did say he put in an extra salad dressing for me. :)  its in the pic, think he sad it was a full 4oz ladel. Not sure of the dressing but  hey I'm going to put it on e bay to cover my $10 of gas driving back &forth!

I want my money back plus the $5 I tipped the server when she decided to finally come to the curbside.

Katelyn Norman is a young girl that has captured the hearts of our community (Campbell County, TN) She has fought cancer for two years and now at the age of 15 is creating a bucket list for her last days. One of the dreams she has is to travel to Italy! Our small town is trying to get her there. This past Sunday I ate at the Applebee's on merchants dr in Knoxville. The manager was doing a wonderful job at talking to people about donating money for a young boy who had a disability to send him on his dream trip. If their is anyway to help with Katelyn it would be greatly appreciated.

CHELSEA WELCH: TOP TEN FINALIST!

Celebration today, as we are so excited to announce Chelsea Welch has made the Top 10 finalists for the 2013 Young & Free St. Louis "Spokester" Search! Congratulations Chelsea on achieving this goal and the votes needed for you move on! This is fantastic news. 

Chelsea said earlier today with excitement. THANKS EVERYONE! I made the top ten! Stay tuned for more information as I seek my dream job! 

As her supporters we will most defiantly stay tuned, awaiting to see her next assignment: To make a more serious video and write a pretty personal blog entry about some mistakes she has made with money. The top ten finalists will now move on to a special panel. We will continue to keep you posted on her progress.

Our community "Picking Apples" is so proud of Chelsea, and once again commend her on her amazing strength demonstrated through out this whole ordeal. We know that she is our candidate of choice, and continue to look forward to delivering great news. 

Go getem girl!!!
link_name: The Top 10 Spokester Applicants Are Posted!

Me and my family just had a horrible experience at Applebees in Huber Heights, Ohio! We waited at our table for 15 mins before anyone even came to the table to ask for our drinks. Finally the waitress came over to take our drink order & food order. When she bought back the drinks they were in small styrofoam cups because she said they didnt have any clean. Eventually 30-45 mins. later she brought regular plastic cups. Then as we waited for our food that took forever and when she brought out the food she walked away and never gave us silverware. I had to waive her down to ask if we could have silverware, she said well I dont know if we have any clean right now, but I will check. Well they did, but she just handed it to us wrapped in a big stack of napkins and they were extremely cold and nasty. She only checked on us once and was doing whatever else she was doing. My husband had to go to the car with my daughter who was 1 1/2 because she was starting to get cranky, so my son and I stayed and tried to finish our food. Well he got choked on a corn dog and I jumped up and walked over to him , beating on his back and raising his arms in the air. The tables around me just sat there and staired as Im doing this. ( Not that they had to do anything because I had it under control, but I just figured someone would at least ask if hes ok)!  I became very frustrated and just  wanted to get my food and bill and just go because it was a horrible experience. WELL again I couldnt find my waitresss, finally I seen her accross the room, so I hd to walk to her to get my bill and 2 boxes to go. As a family of 4 and (2 small kids) my husband and I dont take the kids out very often because we dont have the extra money. I was really hoping for great service and a nice relaxing meal. I WONT be returning to any Applebees Resturants. !! I just wanted it to be heard!! Thanks for reading this.

Hello, I am a proud resident of West Webster NY, a Marine Corps combat Vet and business owner of American K9 Training Services LLC. 

I am sure you and your employees are aware of the tragedy that hit our community on Christmas Eve.
 
I have started an online fund drive to be coordinated with the W Webster Fire Department. I ask for your companys consideration to join me in helping the victims families and the wounded firemen, who have a long road to recovery. Through our web drive we can make a difference in these peoples lives.The business community in the Rochester has already started making contributions. Together we can make a difference. 



Thank you for your consideration. All companies/individual donors will be publicly recognized for their contributions, if you would like to remain anonymous you may do so and if you would like the monetary amount to be hidden you may as well. 



Just as an idea, a few companies are donating the total proceeds of their own employee match drive to our cause like Vocas located in Maryland. Sydor Optics (Rochester NY) made a generous donation through the weblink. 

Attached below is the link to the drive
 
http://www.giveforward.com/helpthefamiliesofthewebsternyvolfireman?utm_source=giveforward&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=supporter_thank_gift&hid=843458&cid=1210858
 

or just go to the give forward website and type in " The victims of the Webster NY Firefighters tragedy." 



Any exposure we can get for this would be greatly appreciated! If there is any question about validity you can observe this donation drive on the Town of Webster website. 


Sincerest Regards,
 Tommy Doehler
 AMK9
(585) 704-4219
 www.americank9trainingservices.com

Was excited to order the double barrel whiskey sirloins for the first time and was very disappointed in the presentation. This is the exact image as it came to my table. I got a whopping 2 little pieces of mushroom and a string or two of onion. It was very dry as well and over cooked. It was Nothing like the menu described. I was expecting a decent pile of mushrooms, onions and peppers. If that is how it's actually supposed to look I'll never order it again. The manager said that all of them were pre-measured and didn't act like  there was a problem with how it came out. She just stared at me like I was crazy after I asked her if she would find this acceptable if she was the customer. How do you pre-measure 2 slices of mushroom?? I don't recall even seeing any peppers. I ordered an additional side of mushrooms, peppers and onions after finding out this is all I'm supposed to get.  -Paducah, KY.

Fern Creek, KY: I stopped to have a late dinner with my daughter last night (27-Dec) and realized when I changed for volleyball practice I forgot to grab my wallet. After an awkward moment, I made arrangements with the manager to pay. Realizing one of my other daughters may be on her way home I asked her to stop by the house, grab my wallet and join us. She arrived and as I was showing the server my wallet she told me the booth in front of me already paid my tab. 

Unsure if I looked homeless, hot or the fact my 10 year said, "I haven't eaten in forever, my stomach acid is eating my spine," that put the neighborly trio into action. Regardless, thank you very much and I will pay it forward myself.

I wanted to share the story of what happened to my family when we were at the Applebees in St. Cloud, MN last week on Tuesday. We were there to celebrate my fathers 63rd birthday when the night started out poorly from the beginning. First our waitress waited an unusually long time to just take our drink order. Then we waited again as long to actually receive our drinks. The appetizer actually arrived before our drinks. Obviously it took forever for our food to get to our table and when it did, it was cold. My alfrdeo dish was also dry and my mom didnt even get the soup she had ordered. We explained this to the manager and she was going to adjust our bill and give us desserts on Applebees. As if that wasnt a bad enough experience, this is actually when my story goes from BAD to HELL. While waiting for our desserts, my sister suddenly started having a seizure. We all scrambled to get out of the booth to help her. My mom and screamed for someone to call 911. Customers immediately started gathering around our area to watch our family drama. After several LONG minutes, 2 Applebees employees slowly approached our table and said that they had called 911. They acted like nothing serious was happening and then joined the customers watching my sister twitching on the floor. When the paramedics finally arrived my family was in a chaotic crisis mode. My sister was just becoming conscious and was confused and upset. My mother was taking it very hard and was sobbing. It was at this time that the Applebees manager decided that she needed to get my mothers phone number and other information and have her sign a waiver saying that Applebees wasnt liable for what happened to my sister! She was basically harassing her for her information and my mother was having a hard time remembering things as she was so upset. I am APPALLED at how Applebees handled this entire situation! Applebees is supposed to be a family restaurant. What a joke! I expected someone to come over and announce to the customers standing there staring at my sister to go back to their seats. I also expected a Applebees employee to treat us compassionately and realize the seriousness of the situation and not harass us to sign waivers. We will never go back there again and will tell everyone we know not to go there either.

I ordered Applebee's this evening.  This is what I got.... I am unimpressed.  This is the second time this has happened to me.  Second time I have ordered from an Applebee's.... I will not be eating at any of your establishments in the future because of this.

At location 2060 E. Osceola Parkway, Kissimmee, FL.

Josh, the manager, scheduled me for an interview, for a position with the restaurant. I spoke with him initially on 12.20.12 and the interview was arranged for 4:30PM 12.21.12. When I arrived I was told that Josh was not there and that another manager would interview me. I waited for a complete hour before anyone even acknowledged me. At 5:45PM Josh come to the table and handed me an application and stated he was "unable to find" the previous one I had filled out. I waited another 15 mins for Josh to return to the table for the interview. When I asked him if they were even any positions available, he stated that they were "only accepting applications at the time, all the current positions were filled", after which I got up and leave. I have been looking for a job long enough to know that anyone who says they are "only accepting applications" is NOT HIRING. I am an Army veteran, strong leader, smart and diligent worker, my valuable time was wasted. It reflects poorly on the location and the staff of Applebee's. Work is hard to come by and gas is too expensive. My time and energy to have been wasted. Any of the 3 managers in the building could have suggested I come in another time. I will not accept this kind of disrespect, I want to know actions will be taken to ensure this doesn't happen again to me or anyone else. I WANT A HAND WRITTEN APOLOGY FROM JOSH, CHRIS, AND TOM for wasting my time and not even acknowledging I was there. 

Jaron Dobard

Hey Applebee's!  I've never written anything on here before, but I do recall having quite the blast following your page (all of the ARG love, you remember I'm sure).  Now, several weeks later, I come to find a long string of complaints about the Applebee's organization reminiscent of what I'd see on Walmart's page.  

I just want to let you know that I love the Applebee's here in Cedar City, UT.  The manager always comes out to see how everyone is doing, the food is GREAT, and the service is wonderful.  One of my friends works in the kitchen there, and he's told me that it's one of the cleanest places he's ever seen.  All in all, everything is amazing.  

So don't give up hope Applebee's.  For every bad potato, I'm sure there are at least several restaurants who offer amazing service. 

Anyway, just wanted to let you know how I felt.  Givin' you some love from afar ARG team! 

Matt <3

Last night at a local Applebee's, there was a guy my age who sat at a table near me. My waitress, Tiffany, asked what he was waiting on. He told her a date. As Tiffany came up to me, I asked what she told him. She told me a date, but doesn't think the date will be arriving. Knowing what it feels to be in his situation, I decide to pay for his meal. It sucks. His date wasted his time and made him drive out to Applebee's from Viera. He thanked me and what I did put a smile on his face. I felt bad for him.

Dear Applebee's:
I have been a huge fan for a long time, well sadly that has all changed.... That is thanks to the newest addition to Applebee's located in Canton TX. This Applebee's has opened my eyes to some huge flaws your company has when it comes to employees! I personally know that this specific location does not treat it's employees the way they should! They have them work for 10hours straight with ABSOLUTELY NO breaks! This is illegal and needs to be reported!! YOUR EMPLOYEES SHOULD NOT BE TREATED LIKE SLAVES!! I have a few other complaints but wont list every single one of them! I have been to this location and had to wait an hour for our food and then when we get it 50% of all the things we order are incorrect, and still I was willing to stand by Applebee's but NO MORE!!! I know that our family and friends have spent outrageous amounts of money at Applebee's but we will not being doing that anymore if you can not treat your employee's who are a big part of the Applebee's experience better! They don't make enough in my opinion, they need to at least be treated properly! And treating them like prisoners will not do, and until this is addressed, my family will not be going to Applebee's nor will we recommend it to our friends!! Thanks for your time!

One time I ate at one of your establishments and for some reason I got a wild hare and ordered the baja potatoe boats.  When it reached our table there was literally a bite taken out of it.  No joke. For this atrocity I emplore you to pay to fabricate a full to scale baja potato boat that can seat at least 3 people.  If this demand is not met I will have no other choice to start a competing chain called Pearwasp's and give you a run for your money.  I'll do it.  I'm pretty bored right now.
Tis the Season for "Sharing"
Hello, Applebee's. Do you like potatoes?

We were unsatisfied with our experience today. The potato twisters were burned, the sweet tea tasted strange, the ribs were served cold, and the service was mediocre. We sent the ribs back to be warmed up and had the sweet tea replaced with a soda. See attached photo of the potato twisters. I tried to submit my complaint at applebees.com but  the page wouldn't process it. We paid a total of $71.25 for our meals; the experience was NOT worth the price.

I'm disgusted with the behavior of your manager, Dorothy Harris, at the Covington, GA location. Her behavior is not only illegal but deplorable and ignorant. Breastfeeding is the healthiest thing a mother can do for her child, unlike feeding children your company's food. The fact that this manager not only behaved illegally but went out of her way to HUMILIATE a customer and call the police is reason enough to fire her. Wouldn't you fire an employee who broke the law and served alcohol to a minor? She should be fired as well. Maybe during your "customer service" training you should show a brief clip on the health benefits of breastfeeding and teach your employees that it's protected by law. I will never again eat at your establishment and I will discourage my friends from doing so as well. Ga. Code  31-1-9 (1999) states that the breastfeeding of a baby is an important and basic act of nurture which should be encouraged in the interests of maternal and child health and allows a mother to breastfeed her baby in any location where the mother and baby are otherwise authorized to be. (1999 SB 29, Act 304; 2002 SB 221)

I am writing to inform you about a recent experience I had with the Manager, James, at the Applebees location at 3702 Easton-Nazareth Highway, Easton, Pennsylvania. I ordered a SIZZLING apple pie for dessert. I have ordered this dessert numerous times. The pie is supposed to be warm. I got my pie and it was cold not even warm in the slightest bit. I sent the pie back. While waiting for a new one, the manager, James, came to my table. The first words out of his mouth were What is going on? I was taken aback by his tone and his wording but I proceeded to try and tell him what my complaint was. I managed to get about five words out before he interpreted me and started on a rant about how he was going to take the skillet and make it hot hot hot. He was rude and extremely disrespectful.  I told him that I no longer wanted it at all. He said well he is already making it and I repeated my request that I did not want it. He stomped off saying well we will just throw it away then.  This to me is unacceptable behavior for anyone in service let alone the Manager. I work in retail and if a customer comes to me with a Complaint the first words out of my mouth are always Im sorry and how can I fix it for you. Your manager obviously lacks the basics of customer service and as long as he is the manager there, I will never be going back!

Well I have to vent we have 2 applebees where I live one on the north end and one on the south end I always go to the south they know me by name im in there 2-3 times a week and spend lots of money in there. Well last week my daughter wanted to take me to lunch/dinner it was 4 pm in the afternoon she had to be at work at 5 we ordered the 2 for 20 I got the new chipotle steak and waited 42 minutes for it. The manger came over I knew he was the manger by his tag never introduced himself......and this is what he said to me......Well was it worth the wait.........are you kidding me I had to put it in a to go box so that my daughter would not be later for work. Never offered to take anything off the ticket for us a courtesy for the long wait. Then when the waitress......who I must say did a great job till she brought the ticket she always kept check on and apologized sincerely for the wait. Well when she brought the ticket she had the nerve to ask me would you like me to get my manger to take something off your ticket for your wait........first of all I came in there with the intention of paying for what I ordered.....but the most courteous thing for you to have done was went to your manger had him give a little discount for a 42 minute wait on a 4 oz steak then came over to the table gave the ticket and say as a courtesy to you for the long wait Ive had my manger discount your ticket. Needless to say the $10 tip that the waitresses get when I go in the south store she didnt get as much she got half. The ones in the south store love for me to sit in there section Im not hard to wait on and they know its an easy $10 bucks for them!

AVOID the Applebee's at 4000 Park Blvd, Pinellas Park, FL. The staff (excluding our waitress) is unprofessional and the management is condescending. I have a medical condition that was evidently the source of amusement for some of the staff there, they were laughing and making faces at me behind my back; my wife saw their antics and was getting angry. We finished our meal, paid the tab and left. when we got home, my wife called the restaurant, talked to a manage. The manager said he would talk to the staff, did not want to lose us as customers (we ate there at least once a month, twice at the most) and said he would send us coupons for a free meal there. Haven't gotten the so-called coupons; I have a feeling the manager was just patronizing my wife and had no intention of doing anything to rectify he situation. Don't think the wife and I will ever patronize Applebee's again.

I was really impressed with the staff at the Applebee's in Cedar Lake, Biloxi, MS (951 Cedar Lake Rd. Biloxi, MS 39532). My fellow firefighters and myself went out to Applebee's to grab a bite to eat. We were in our dress uniforms because it was 9/11 and we wanted to honor those that are no longer with us. I was really surprised when the staff, not just our server and the manager, but the entire staff stopped to thank us for our service. It made us all feel extremely welcomed. The server was extremely nice and genuinely cared for us. He was talkative and knew the menu well. He had conversations with us and made us feel like we were best friends with him. We did have a problem with my meal, I ordered the Cajun Shrimp Pasta and when it came out it had mushrooms in it. I am extremely allergic to mushrooms and when I found them I immediately told my server. He apologized and I felt like he meant it. He then took my plate and told me another one would be out shortly. I didn't have to wait long at all before he brought me out a new one. He handled that situation like a champ. I was really impressed and extremely satisfied. When we got the check we noticed that the Appetizer Sampler we ordered to split between all of us was taken off and we were given a 10% discount. Not only that, but because we had a party of 7 we were automatically given a gratuity charge. Our server marked that out and said we didn't have to pay that because "[we've] already paid enough." I had tears in my eyes when I left. Not because we had a bad time, but because that restaurant genuinely cared about us and what we do. That feeling is priceless. If all Applebee's are like this I will always find one where ever I travel. I'd like to thank the staff there and tell them what a wonderful night they made for us.

Applebee's in Rocky Mount, VA will be hosting a Flapjack Fundraiser Breakfast for one of our employees who was involved in an accident during a visit to Myrtle Beach, SC following her high school graduation.  She sustained a brain injury and her recovery has been slow, but hopeful.  Jessica's family have been by her side during this traumatic event, and wishes to thank everyone for their continued support and prayers. Jessica is a vibrant 18 year old girl who aside from working at Applebee's is a volunteer member of the Franklin County Rescue Squad.

"Friends for Jessica" would like to invite everyone to join us on July 7th, 2012, from 8-10am for a Flapjack Fundraiser Breakfast at the Applebee's in Rocky Mount. 100% of all proceeds will benefit Jessica to help with her medical expenses. Please come and support this beautiful young lady and pray for her continued recovery!
 
Tickets will be $5 each and can be purchased at 3 Rocky Mount locations:
 
Applebee's
Carter Bank and Tust
Franklin County Rescue Squad
 
Donations will also be accepted. Any questions or concerns please contact Dennis Cruz or Beth Simms at (540)489-7772
 
Please share and help spread the word!

I went to try your Nawlins Sizzling Entrees, and to my surprise I wasn't happy with my meal at all.. and to make matters worse, you guys lied on your menu about the ingredients. If you guys advertise that you use Andouille Sausages, I would think it would make sense to you use Andouille!! Oh but that wasn't the case with my experience yesterday. You guys use cheap Hillshire Farms smoked sausages, thinking people won't pay attention to details. So I had the waitress ask the cook what type of sausage was used and she came back and told me it was for sure andouille but, that wasn't good enough for me so I had to challenge her response from the chef so I asked to speak to the manager and then he went back and checked and came back to tell me that it wasn't andouille and apologized. I was so butt hurt, Applebee's please take care of this matter before other people find out that you guys don't really use andouille sausage.  Stockton ca

Dislike!  Rediculously bad service pretty much every time we've tried to eat at Applebee's.  

Tonite, tried to celebrate a high school graduation,  ordered drinks and several appetizers.  An hour later we still had no food. Couldn't even get water.  Drinks arrived after about a 20 minute wait.  The soda was flat.  Zero carbonation.  

We are officially done!!!  Took the manager 15 minutes to come and talk with us.  Were told, i don't know what happened.  What happened is our order hadn't even been started after an hour wait.

This is the 3rd or 4th time this has happened to us.  Pretty much every Applebee's in Fresno California sucks!!!

Applebee's famous slogan is "Welcome to the neighborhood". How ironic ....According to the Tupelo, Mississippi Applebee's manager Toni Noah, Applebee's is no longer able to donate to any fundraisers in their communiites or "neighborhoods.' What a shame. A $20.00 gift card is apparently too much to donate to a community fundraiser. Well guess what ....Applebee's ...I just moved out of the neighborhood and will not be dining there anymore..Neither will the 250 members of the community. Thanks:)

Boycott of Applebee's in York, PA for dening service to a disabled woman, her husband and her Service dog!!!
Ivan watching his SPURS play.

So a retired chief of a fire department and his wife, who needs a working dog to get around, are told to wait after 45 minutes so the manager can proudly state he's kept the working dog from having to go to far in the restaurant?  Wonder how the DOJ will feel about this after reviewing the ADA act? Huh, and they have the nerve to have local fire and police items on their walls.  Shame
Hot and thirsty?  We can fix that.

I don't appreciate my sis in law's mother having to wait over 40mins at the East York, PA location, to ask y she wasn't seated yet & every who comes in after her & her husband are seated right away & all bc the manager on night duty 5/25/12 didn't want to explain to customers why a service dog is in there or hear complaints. Most people know service dogs are welcomed everywhere, they are trained to do a job! Applebee's was always my first choice of going out to eat but they have lost a valuable customer bc that is discrimination & wrong I do not care who it would have been!

We had friends who went out to dine last evening at one of our local Applebee's. They were denied being seated because of her canine companion. The manager was overheard saying that he did not want customers see the dog walking through the restaurant. Please help us in boycotting Applebee's. In this day an age to put this family through this is intolerable. Thanks for everyone's cooperation!

Applebee's, I recently heard that a disable person was kicked out because they had their service dog with them.  I feel you need to address this w/ every single employee individually in a meeting.  I have enjoyed your food in the past but don't know how I feel about going there anymore.
What are you grilling up this weekend?  We got some steaks and burgers on over here.
I am. Parent of a special needs little girl and am so disgusted to know a person with a service dog was denied access to your restaurant . We along with a lot of our friends will never visit again..

Your restaurant in East York PA DENIED access to a customer who had an ASSISTANCE DOG, a couple days ago,because they didn't want their other customers to COMPLAIN.  FYI ~  This is ILLEGAL.  FYI ~  I will no longer be a patron at ANY Applebee's from here on out because I'm COMPLAINING because this was done.  ASSISTANCE DOGS are ALLOWED in ANY public building, and so is HUMAN DECENCY!

status_message: Our Applebee's | Rockwall, TX location catered for this National Guard group before they left for Afghanistan last Friday.  It was the least we could do to say thank you for serving our country.

Applbee's in Rockwall, TX catered to the National Guard in Greenville, TX as a group of soldiers were headed out to Afghanistan on 5/18. This picture is of those soldiers and Applebee's Rockwall catering manager, Sharon Hayden. Good luck to you guys!

Monday and Tuesday evenings I had my usual dinner at the Applebee's on Central Avenue and 694 in Fridley, MN...with Denise gone it is no longer the same...the joy and the spirit is gone...Denise tells me she is fine and not to worry about her...that is good, but the fun is now gone...

Today was a special day in June and my life...this is the day in 1951 when I first met June...tommorow is also a special day...TODAY WEDNESDAY MAY 23RD  2012 IS THE 61ST ANNIVERSARY OF JUNE AND MY FIRST DATE AT A LITTLE RESTAURANT CALLED THE SPOT ON LAKE POKEGAMA, CHETEK, WISCONSINTHAT DAY IN 1951 WAS ALSO A WEDNESDAYI HAD JUST GOTTEN HOME ON THE TRAIN TO START A 15 DAY LEAVE FROM MY ARMY ASSIGNMENT IN BALTIMORE, MARYLANDCAN YOU TAKE TIME OUT TO LOOK AT OUR STORY?:

WE WERE MARRIED IN 1952 AND COMPLETED 56 YEARS OF MARRIED LIFE WHEN JUNE PASSED AWAY AS A VICTIM OF ALZHEIMERS

http://junebergalzheimers.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=225&Itemid=506
link_name: June and Stan - Divine Appointment or Chance Encounter?

19 students from Kansas City, Mo. School districts Culinary Arts Program stopped in Applebees Culinary Center to learn hands-on food preparation safety, kitchen safety and made some tasty dishes in the process. The group was divided into teams, each making a dish, which their peers  tasted and reviewed. The culinary program is part of the Career and Technical Education program which offers students hands-on, vocational training for post-graduation job readiness.
link_name: Applebee's Welcomes Kansas City Culinary Arts Program

status_message: Have to say that my family had one of the worst experiences at Applebee's tonight.  We went in and about 45 minutes later they finally came and said that the cooks burnt the steaks and should be out shortly.  Then my steak and my husbands steak fajitas came out and I had ordered mine medium well.  So I went to cut into it and it was medium rare.  I told the waiter and he looked at it and then decided to argue with me that it was medium well and wanted to know how much more cooked I wanted it.  Then took it back.  So finally after being there for about an hour I got to eat!  So frusterating especially with a 4 year old and after already waiting for our food for so long.

I was at the location on 125th Street and 5th Ave. There was a hair in my food, which I pulled out and threw to the floor. I told the waitress immediately. I didn't eat any of the food. The manager, Jomo Adams, came over and implied that I was lying about the situation. The manager was standoffish when I requested a new meal. I know it's low-priced food, but is asking for hairless food too much to ask?

I just had the Shrimp Parmesan and Steak last night. It was amazing. At first the steak was cooked more to a rare than the medium I had ordered, but they handled it very well and brought it back out prefect! And my son ordered a grilled cheese sandwich that he didn't like. The manager NOTICED the disappointment on his face and asked if he wanted something else. So she personally delivered a fresh hotdog at no additional charge. GREAT experience at the Lewisburg, Pa Applebee's!

I filed a complaint online (which I have NEVER done before.. I am not that person) over a horrible experience I had at a store and nobody has contacted me?  I guess that shows my business or experience is not really worth any of your time.. thanks for making it clear.

I am presently setting in your restaurant at Castleton Sq, Indy.  I ordered my favorite salad Santa Fe Chicken.  It was horrible!   Absolutely horrible.  The manager looked at it and said "wow, I can look at it and see that's all wrong!"  I declined a replacement salad.  Why would anyone take a second chance on bad/foul tasting food.  I am not that brave with my precious body!  Why did you change the recipe?  I have been a loyal customer ordering that salad since the 90's.   Oh well I guess my New Years resolution will to find a new restaurant with a Santa Fe Chicken salad.  Shame on you Applebees...:-(

Last Sat we took the kids to Applebees for dinner...HUGE mistake!  They were airing the Ultimate Fighting Championship on EVERY tv in the place.  I hadn't noticed what the tv's were showing until one fighter broke his opponents' arm & half the restaurant cheered!  Then it was replayed and replayed & replayed!  So much for a family dining in my "neighborhood" restaurant!  I asked the manager if we could sit somewhere else and he said that all the tv's were on that channel!  Really Applebees?  Leave one section open for families who want to eat in your restaurant-air what you want, but you won't find us eating there anymore!

As the Holiday approaches, our thoughts are with our Active Duty Military troops.  Thank You for all you do.
Hey Applebee's! How about an email coupon periodically, rather than just promotions? Coupons sure help get me in the door.

I want to give a very special thanx to your team at the General Booth Blvd, Virginia Beach, VA location.  Last night while I was on an Ambulance shift, my crew and I attempted to have dinner there, the city was not too cooperative though and shortly after being seated and orders taken we got dispatched to a seizure call.  That call rolled into a follow on accident with vehicle fire call, and then we were sent again to an unconscious victim across the city.  So after 4 hours of this we finally got a break.  I contacted the restaraunt and spoke with the manager on shift and with only 15 minutes left to closing, she had our entire orders remade and packaged ready to go.  She even offered to wait for us or she would deliver to the fire station in case we got called out again.  This kind of customer service and support of public safety folks is why I continue to be a huge fan of your franchise.  Thank you very much.

Bill Cross,
Courthouse Rescue, VBEMS
Virginia Beach, VA
