My friends and I thought that buying our Chik Fil A milkshakes prior to ordering our food would be a phenomenal idea so we could drink them while we eat because Chik Fil A milkshakes are obv better than any other......unfortunately the moment we walked into the Applebee's after buying them the person who sat us told us to confiscate them...we were  furious. Chik Fil A milkshakes are not cheap they're about $3.00 each and we don't have that kinda $$$ to blow. i mean they're obviously FROM CHIK FIL A because we had the receipt with us for proof. We did not have a splendid time there. P.s. service was awful, plates/cups were dirty, chicken quesadillas were left w/o the chicken, and the table wasn't set correctly.

My family and I visited the Applebee's at Northgate Mall, Hixson(Chattanooga), TN. 12/4/11.  My food was cold and the manager took it back to be "recooked".  30 min, later he brought it back microwaved until the pasta was like cardboard.  My family had already finished eating.  I had nothing to eat and nothing except an apology from the manager--no free drink, no offer of a different entree.  I contacted Applebee's complaint line and was told the franchisee would be in touch with me.  They have not!!  Obviously, Applebee's does not supervise their franchises and the franchise owner there does not care.  If you come to Chattanooga, don't eat at the Applebees at Northgate Mall!!

Well went to Applebee's today and walked right out after talking to the manager at the North Canton, Ohio Store. The reason? Applebee's no long respects my right to protect my family and myself in there store by posting a sign that says that as a law abiding citizen I can't bring my concealed gun in there. In some other states, this sign would carry no weight of law but here in Ohio, it does. So without that respect, then I and my family will be taking our business elsewhere. Went into a local steak house and there was a sign there, told the manager the same thing and right there on the spot he took the sign down. There will be soon 300,000 CHLs in Ohio. It is a shame that Corporate Applebee's wants to alienate that many costumers in a weak economy..

I took my daughter to the New Hartford, NY Applebee's yesterday and the food I ordered ended up having an eyelash in it.  Well according to the waiter I ordered a second meal because they took the first on off my bill which had the eyelash.  TO ME I DIDN'T ORDE A SECOND MEAL I WANTED MY MEAL FIXED SO I COULD EAT.  Well I got my bill and the first meal *I GUESS* was free because of the eyelash but I had to pay for the second meal I ordered *I DIDN'T ORDER TWO MEALS* I had to pay for.  I thought a restaurant would pay for your meal if there is a hair in it.  Especially because customer satisfaction.  I'm really disappointed with this - I love Applebee's and go there all the time with my family.  It might be a while till I go there again. :(

I was at the applebees in newburgh, ny at around 1:15PM sunday november 20, 2011.  My family took me for my 50th birthday.  After we were done a manager took my check to charge me for my family meal.  He brings me the check back and he not only charge me my family meal but another family on my credit card.  This has happen once before at this same store on November 11, 2011.  The other manager came to explain that this was a new employee in training.  We were highly upset we came out to celebrate my 50th birthday and was charge incorectly twice within a two week period.  The manager then offer what he can do to make us  happy.  I felt he should not charge us for our meal, but he was trying to buy us with some cheap offer.  I will never go to any applebees particularly the one in Newburgh, NY route 300.

My daughter is a waitress at the Applebee's at Patterson Ave in NC and invited me to be a volunteer on Friday for Veterans Day.  "OF COURSE I'LL DO IT!"...so I did.  I will have to add that I had the BEST TIME meeting so many veterans young and old that have contributed to our Freedom.  They ranged from B52 Bomber Mechanics to Paratroopers and Infantry and they all had their stories they were eager to share me.  It was AN ABSOLUTE HONOR!!!!  I can't think of any other place I'd have rather been than sharing THEIR meals with them on THEIR special day.  God Bless those who served and continue to serve, as well as their families.  I thank them from the bottom of my heart for their dedication  and sharing their day with ME!!  ~<3~

Best Moment of my day (11-11-11): A guest gave their server a mission - find a veteran and buy their spouse's meal.  The guest gave the server $20 and a note that said "May God Bless You."  The server had to leave for the day so I got to help complete the mission.  The expression of the veteran, his wife and daughter were priceless when I gave them the money and note!  Plus I discovered that this gentleman served in Vietnam like my dad did and his division actually worked with my dad's division - I wonder if they ever met.  I have the best job in the world on veteran's day - I spend my day thanking our heroes.  Thanks you to all our veterans. WELCOME HOME!!!!

The Manager at at the Green Bay store came around to the tables looking for veterans and thanking each of them for their service.  My husband is a Vietnam Veteran.... after he thanked him for serving he added that he hopes this in some small way is a statement for the way the vets were treated when they came home.  I got choked up and cried.  It was my husband's best Veteran's Day ever.  Thank you Applebee's, we are now lifetime fans.

My wife, son and I visited this location. The service was bad and the portion size of the food was shockingly small. The service was with two competing servers that never left us alone. If one server wasn't asking us questions, then the other server came by to ask the same question. We ordered apps to come first and then ordered our entrees after the server returned with drinks. The apps came and 2 minutes behind that were our meals. We had to tell them to take them back until we finished what was laughingly called our appetizers ($29.98 of nothingness). When the entrees came, they were no longer hot. At the end of the meal, we asked for a bag to carry my son's unfinished and overpriced chicken. The server said yes and then ignored us. After waiting 5 minutes for his return (and he passed us twice in that time), we left.

Hey, so I just scrolled down this wall a little bit and it's a shame that people feel the need to downtalk your business by complaining about  bad service... ok, so we all have had a bad service or two, but these people are getting a little overdramatic!  I mean, like, having to wait 10 minutes to place a drink order... sheesh!  that's really not that bad.  All I'm saying is, I have always enjoyed eating at Applebee's and I think you've got a great menu, and yes, maybe sometimes, a waiter made a mistake or service was about 5 minutes later than normal, but you're employees are human, and I think they are doing a great job of putting their best foot forward.  All you complainers should just talk directly to the manager or something instead of ripping Applebee's apart publicly here on their facebook FAN page!

Went to applebee's in Aberdeen, MD. Had the worst experience. I usually go to Bel Air, but decided to change it up. We go to our Yucca Valley, CA applebee's almost weekly.  No problems...if there have been slight issues here and there we NEVER complain.  HOWEVER...tonight - unbelievable.  We (hubby, me and our two girls) order our drinks - my diet coke comes and i take a huge gulp - thirsty - only to swallow what tasted like pure ammonia.  I had my hubby taste it to see if i was losing my mind - he had to spit it out.  We told waitress - she apologized - she was great.  Assistant Manager Sherri came over and said sorry - but we don't use ammonia (assuming we were lying i suppose for a free meal?)  My hubby explained i am on specific meds that i can't have things mixed - can't even drink tonic water.  The Assistant Manager Sherri - apparently a doctor as well - informs in a sort of laugh that it won't interact with my medication.  My husband is now irritated.

Can you please list/serve some foods that are gluten free besides salad. It is so painful to go to your restaurant anymore not knowing if something has gluten and/or casein. Gluten/wheat sensitivity is very wide spread.

If I go to a restaurant and say I have gluten sensitivity I expect this to be taken seriously(a lot of times the chef will come out to actually discuss a dish he can make) instead when I go I have your waitress roll her eyes at me and suggest salad.(Really salad? ) I think staff education on allergic reactions is in order.

I went to your Waterville, Maine restaurant tonight and had a good dinner with my family.  Good, that is, until we left.  There were people, including an employee, sitting and standing on the benches just outside the door who were smoking.  My husband, children, and I had to walk through their smoke.  Just before dinner, we had been at the pediatrician seeking assistance for my daughter's allergies.  As you can guess, the smoke didn't help her situation.  I don't think we will be returning any time soon.  Smoking should not be allowed directly in front of the only entrance/exit.

The manager didn't even give us anything for this inconvience until we approched him for the fourth time. I also hear that this dog is still beign brought in on many occassions! We were at the bar having dinner and drinks at the Applebee's in Helena MTon friday the 25th and the couple next to us ordered a few Brewtus beer's as had we. They pointed out to the bartender the drinks had been shorted and he told her they were to fill it to the apple on the glass. So they asked for a glass of water no ice (pint) and whe...n they were done with the beer they dumped the pint glass of water into the brewtus glass and bam same place! So paying for a brewtus and not getting anymore beer for the price! She brought it to the bartenders attention who went and told the manager and nothing was done. We were also not happy esp after learning of this deception!!! We go at least every week sometimes more and always order at least 4 beer's each time. I feel so ripped off.

I just have to tell you about a nice experience I had last time we went to Applebees in Shawnee, Kansas. I took my 2 year old to the bathroom and she insisted on bringing her green crayon with her. On the way back to our table she realized she lost the crayon and was VERY upset. We began to backtrack and look for the crayon when one of the waitresses noticed us looking for it and asked what was wrong. I told her and she said let me get her a new one. She stopped what she was doing and went and got my daughter a new Green crayon. She was very busy and was not even our waitress but she took the time to care about my child being upset and helped to fix the problem! Now that's customer service! I wish now that I had asked her name so I could give her better recognition for helping us have a wonderful evening!!! Thanks Applebees!

here is my little testimonial about being a hostess at applebees :) I read a lot of complains here but this is my opinion behind the host stand. I'm not American and I'm glad that applebees accepted me as their hostess (I applied to different places and i never got any reply/follow up). It's not easy to make an excellent service to everybody but I guarantee we really do the best for our customers! We the hostess try our best to buss our tables, the servers have to run food and talk to the customers, the expo (someone who prepare the food) has to yelled at the kitchen to keep up the time, etc. Sometimes we have a rough night where literally 50 people came at once. Im just saying :) we are still human and we DO REALLY TRY OUR BEST. I love to work at applebees and I love my customer's smile :) it really made my day! And you all are invited to come to our little town, Hays KS to see what I'm saying ^^ Have a great sunday!

I just wanted to share my thoughts about Apleebes, I've been reading the comments here and all I see is complaining, so I wanted to say that I love it!!
I've been working at an Applebees here in Monterrey, Mexico, and it's been wonderful! People have no idea how much work and effort everyone puts into making it all perfect! The food is delicious, the servise is great and the abiance is my favorite! I just wanted to thank you for all your efferts u put into making this restaurant absolutely wonderful! It's a pleasure working for and with you!

My entire family has been loyal customers for years and visit our local Applebee's on a regular basis!! Last night is the FIRST TIME I've ever had a MAJOR complaint!  My family went for dinner and as usual ordered my 2-year-old son an apple juice with his kids meal.  Instead my son WAS SERVED ALCOHOL! They put pre-mixed Long Island Ice Tea in his cup instead of Juice. Luckily, I took the cup away while he was drinking it to take a drink myself so it wouldn't spill. FORTUNATELY, he only had a few drinks of it, but I'm also allergic to alcohol and those 2 drinks I had enough alcohol to give me an allergic reaction! I understand people make mistakes but I cannot understand WHY alcohol and juice are kept in identical containers and kept behind the bar!! YOU NEED TO CHANGE THIS!! -As An employee Of Applebees I must say, there are mistakes. We all make mistakes and aren't perfect. Just like everyone else in the world We try our best to do something and it doesn't always come out 100% perfect. Now, I'm not a cook, or a waitress, But I am a hostess. I usually get griped at a few times out of the day from hungry people. I don't blame these people for Getting so upset, Shoo, I get upset all the time when i'm starving. But, Please understand that the people making your food Aren't just making YOUR food, but they're making everybody elses too.

I just read a couple post on here and I feel people are going a little over board. Restaurants are not perfect, things happen. I've gone places and the meal sucked, but the next time it was excellent. I have never posted it on facebook or rant and raved about it. If you don't like it, then don't go back. If you have real major issues then email the company and complain. But to bash a restaurant because they messed up is nuts. How would you like it if you messed up and someone posted it on facebook and made you look really really bad?

wow people. As a former employee for Applebee's, i will say that mistakes happen. Every restaurant cannot put out every order on time, correctly every single time. Taking it out on a facebook page is no way to handle this. Human beings work there which means we make mistakes. If you really want the problem solved, talk to the manager or call the hotline. Posting on facebook is not going to change a thing.

Hey thanks for never replying to my e-mail I sent you over a week ago, just goes to show your crappy customer service everywhere. And don't bother with your lame response, "Sorry about that, please call us at..." If I wanted to sit on the phone I would have looked up your number already and called you.

COMPLAINT:  Sister forgot her driver's license at home tonight, only had her LTC on her for an ID, still refused for a friend of ours to buy her a drink (she's 21).  Complained to manager but manager still refused the STATE ID that is REQUIRED you be 21 to obtain.  Honestly, this is a different type of license that has MORE personal information than a driver's license AND you must get a QUARRY CHECK on you to have it....and yet she was denied one measly little drink.  What's next?  I should try my passport next time and then complain that it's a FEDERAL ID.  

We generally ENJOY Applebee's but with the party of people (8), which included my boyfriend, father, sister, and friends, even the whole "crew" of us found this offensive and unprofessional.  Once we chewed out whoever was in charge of the restaurant, we still ate there.  I even ordered a MARGARITA and my ID wasn't checked!  (even though I'm certainly not underage, but its the principal, here)

some of the complaints on this wall are silly. i know that servers, hosts and managers should obviously make the guests feel welcome and so on but i just think its very immature to go on publicly about a bad experience. take it up with the manager, call the number thats been listed here numerous times. people make mistakes, they have off days. you have no idea what your server or manager or whoever is going through, or if they're just starting or absolutely anything else that could be happening. maybe they were extremely busy. the possibilities are endless. put yourself in their position. would you want to be talked down about like that if you were them? i am in no way condoning bad service or meaness, im simply saying, calm down. its not the end of the world and everything is going to be okay.

status_message:
To those of you that are upset by the horrible incident at the Flint rd. store in Michigan I would ask you to remember a few things before we " go off the deep end". First, I am a Navy veteran who has been employed by Applebee's for almost 7 years. I take great pride in the fact that our company offers a free meal to veterans and active duty military on Veterans day. To my knowledge, no other chain is or has done this with the exception of Golden Corral. Is anyone currently typing out their rage at this injustice on any of their Facebook pages? Are you calling these other chains and demanding full page appologies? I havent seen any???
      Please dont continue to try and ruin a brand name because of the actions of a few. That would be just as bad as someone thinking that all Marines are horrible because of the actions of one of them.

APPLEBEE'S HERE IS THE SOLUTION TO SO OBVIOUSLY NOT AN ISOLATED CASE......

That
 is correct Applebee's you did not state that what happened was right...
 nor did you state that it was wrong and it will be handled 
appropriately.  

As a Marine Corps Veteran and the aunt of the young men, I would first like to state that
 the best PR move right now would be action.  I fully understand as we 
all do how easy it is to appease with kind words.  However, if 
Applebee's stands by its dedication to Veterans and Veterans service 
organizations, then I suggest the following...

Applebee's needs 
to reprimand, and demote these two individuals at the Miller Road Flint,
 MI Applebee's.  To terminate them would not teach them what they 
obviously do not understand.  

Furthermore, these two individuals need to
 first and foremost PUBLICALLY APOLOGIZE to these boys as well as all of
 my brothers and sisters who have given all and still give all today to 
guard our great land and allow them the freedoms they so disturbingly 
take for granted.  

Second, these two individuals need to spend at the 
bare minimum six months providing community service hours within a 
Veteran's Service Organization.  

I have many in mind as you 
already know we come from a long line of highly honored Marines, 
Soldiers, Sailors, and Airmen.  

Just as all of our men and women show 
their integrity each day by keeping their promise to protect you, your 
children, and your land... I request that if Applebee's indeed has 
integrity that they will stand by their statement of dedication to 
Veterans and Veterans Service Organizations.

This is an easy 
enough request to respond to with action.  If Applebee's chooses not to 
entertain the request nor act on it, then it will be blatantly obvious 
that Applebee's has no integrity and willnot be supported and protected 
by the so many that it failed.  

Action speaks louder then words... we are now waiting... we are watching... just as we always are...

I only pray for you that the right decisions are made because it is only the first shot that counts.....

Our family would like to have your definition of a veteran so, noone looks at us just to think that we would like to have free food... At this time our family will not eat at your establishment... this way Applebees will not think that we are just out to get free food and ultimately cheat them in any way.. Even though our veterans do ensure all americans freedom and rights including those of Applebees...

THIS
 IS FOR THE HOSTESS AND MANAGER AT THE MILLER ROAD APPLEBEE'S IN FLINT, 
MICHIGAN WHO NEED A LESSON IN WHAT IT IS THAT ALLOWS THEM TO SLEEP 
SOUNDLY IN THEIR BEDS AT NIGHT AND WHY THEIR CHILDREN HAVE NOT LEARNED 
THE DESTRUCTION OF WAR FROM THEIR OWN BACKYARDS!  11/11/10 my nephew and two of his friends, one which happens to be a Mar...ine,

After receiving an email from Ft. Knox that my family, the family of a fallen soldier, would be eligible for their Veteran's Day event, (and I re-checked it to be sure). My two teenage sons who are still home visited our local Applebee's to participate. They refused to honor our id cards where it clearly states that he is deceased, & I even told them he was KIA in Iraq...they still said no. They said that the serviceman had to be there in person to participate! I said, this was impossible. No change! WTG, Applebee's!

Hey Applebee's, we enjoyed a great meal at your Palatine, IL store last night, where I noticed your involvement in breast cancer fundraising this month (pink ballooons at the entry doors, co-sponsoring a walk on 9/25) -- what you're doing is GREAT! but September is Childhood Cancer Awareness Month (gold balloons!) so maybe next September, you could do something to promote Childhood Cancer Awareness, then do something for breast cancer in October, which is Breast Cancer Awareness Month. My daughter has been fighting cancer for two years. Since her diagnosis we've learned that childhood cancer research is vastly underfunded compared to other cancers. The pink ribbon is everywhere; we'd like to see more gold ribbons around, for the kids, especially in September! Thanks for all you do!

Is it just me....???? My husband and I went to Applebee's in Tofton, GA to celebrate my birthday.  We enjoyed our meal (the order was wrong but it was good anyway.)The server was attentive and kept our glasses full.  When the bill came, we paid and waited for change. The change should have been $XX.34 We received the dollars but no coins. I wondered if this was a new "policy" I had never heard of though we dine out quite often. We called the waitress back over and just asked "Is there some reason we didn't receive all of our change?" She said "Oh, did I miss something?" looking at the bills in my husband's hand. Continued in the next post....

I thank Applebee's for honoring June and I for our 58th anniversary this week...as you know, June passed away after an 11 year struggle with Alzheimer's....I maintain a web site in June's honor and memory as well as for Alzheimer's awareness...it is also a good source of information for the family who are fighting the Alzheimer's battle...no one who has traveled into the shadows of Alzheimer's has ever returned. There have been no medical or miracle cures....the link to the site for you or for anyone interested is:

http://www.junebergalzheimers.com/

Over 58 years ago, Stan and June Berg became husband and wife in Bloomington, IL. Sadly, June passed away in 2008 - but Applebees in Fridley, MN is honoring her memory with engraved his and hers brass plaques on Stan and Junes favorite booth; so he can still dine with her in spirit. Please read Stans beautiful tribute to June below.
link_name: June and Stan Berg - 1951-2010 - The Years and the Anniversaries

status_message:
To Denise O'Connell the manager of the Applebee's at Central and 694 in Fridley, MN...thank you so much for honoring my wife June and I on our 58th anniversary...June passed away from Alzheimer's October 2008 and I miss her very much...Denise arranged to have brass plates placed on my favorite booth...my side of the booth read: "Stan Berg" and the other side read "June Berg". Denise reminded me that I had said that June was with me in spirit...thanks also for helping me spread the word on Alzheimer's awareness...for those interested please click this link and read the message I had printed in the Minneapolis Star - Tribune in June's honor...

http://junebergalzheimers.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=168&Itemid=262

LOVE Applebee's under 550 cal and weight watchers menu items.  I have a lap band, & can usually find ONE item on a menu that I can eat.  Applebees had 5 under 550 items, plus more that are Weight Watchers items.  I had real choices!  I chose the WW steak Portabello.   The 4 oz steak was the perfect size.  It came with a HUGE portion of steamed broccoli that had a garlic sauce on it.  This broccoli was to die for!  A small portion of red potatoes were also included.  Everything was cooked to perfection and the portion sizes were perfect for anyone who cares about their weight and nutrition.  Applebees has proven that excellent food can be prepared with a reasonable calorie and nutrition count.  Keep up the good work.  America desperately needs this!

would like to send a special thanks to the folks Applebee's on Abbey Road in Charlottesville, VA. They found my backpack with my wallet inside, and shipped it to me at home in IN. I offered to pay for the shipping, but when it arrived it was already paid for. My wallet and everything else were inside, undisturbed--including the $2 in cash that were in the wallet. Jake and the manager Elsa went well above and beyond the call of duty, going out of their way to help me out, and I am so grateful.  They handled my panicked phone call from the road and responded with over-the-top customer service and help. Thank you, thank you, thank you!

I worked at an Applebee's, and went on medical leave for my son's health at the time. I was told that I could have my job back when I was done getting him all straightened out, and just because one of the managers didn't like me, they didn't allow me back. Had me come in to get my schedule and then that's when the GM told me that he couldn't let me come back. I was furiated!! I believe this business is crooked!  There was a girl that was out on medical and they let her come back and she called out all the time, but they wouldn't let me and I was a hard worker! Hopefully NO ONE else has to deal with what I have.

Hello, I was informed today that legally if the servers/carside employees don't make  minimum wage per hour for the day then their employer would have to make up the difference so that they make minimum wage.  So lets say you are slow on a Wednesday evening and tips are very low, at the end of the evening your employer would average it out and if you made less than minimum wage they would pick up the difference.  Has anyone heard of this?

WOW, Both us Vets and Active duty are still talking about Veterans day at Applebees. You lite a Fire under every other Bar and Grill, Restaurant in our area. Thank you Applebee's for treating us vets to a complimentary meal on Veterans Day. I thought I'd see a burger or chicken meal, but was happy to see a 7oz steak!  I paid for the steak, but it went to the friendly and hard working servers in Canton, GA in the form of a tip.

or maybe you need to realize that its your job to give ppl good service. YOu get paid for it. The tip is something extra you are given for pleasing the costumer. Sorry John but with this attitude, no wonder you get 10%

I wish people who came to resturants would learn that 10%-14% or lower is NOT A GOOD TIP!!!!!! 18%-20% IS a good tip.  I wish people would tip us ahead of tip so we know what service to give them!! 10%=bad service 15%=avg service 20%+= good service!  Learn it and spread it!!  Your server will appreciate it!

it is awesome that we served our vets... if you're buthurt over the 2.49 that your vet had to pay for their drink than you should read all the thanks and appreciation that we had for that day. It was advertised and everything that you would have to pay for the drink, and yes it's true it costs the store very little, but then again, if you're getting a meal that's normally 11.99+ obviously we're showing our gratitude. So if you can't read, or hear the advertisements on tv, don't be dumb and try and blame your server for your ignorance.

I think it is awesome that Applebees fed out vets, but I also think it is a bit deceptive that you get the "meal" for free.  A person I know took a veteran to AppleBees and he was forced to pay for his non-alcoholic drink.  When she called the manager to ask if they had made a mistake she was told "nope that is correct, they must pay for their drink."  Fountain drinks are really cheap for and restaurant to buy, can't they include the drink too???? I think that the whole meal should be included with non-alcoholic beverage.

We need to start a cause to make Applebee's "Americas Restaurant."  Nobody else took the time, spent the money or tried as hard as this organization did .  No one ever just opened themselves up to such a financial sacrifice.  They cared and took care of our vets amd troops (soldiers, sailors, airmen, marines, coasties).  Who wants to start this ball rolling? Hey VA, you listening?  (gov agencies can't favor a specific business....) but VFW?  Legion?  DAV?  C'mon......All your members were served if they tried.  Can we give Applebee's a boost?

Thx, SGTRED, SFC, USA, Ret.

Thanks Applebees for my free meal Wednesday night in Wilmington, NC. I have another loved on that had the privilege of having his well deserved meal as well in Chicago. Thank you, thank you for honoring vets yesterday!  It wasn't just the free entree that mattered.  It was the chance to be near other vets with a common experience, memories, and concerns.  My husband is a Viet Nam vet.  He was nervous about going, but once we were at Applebee's surrounded by other vets and the caring staff the day turned into a very positive experience.  We are greatful for your wonderful idea, and thankful for the opportunity.  Let there be peace in the world.
Nice idea Applebee's, too bad here in San Diego it was a 3 hour wait. It's the thought that counts though.

As a server at Applebee's in Martinsburg, West Virginia, I have to say working on Verteran's Day was one of the most rewarding experiences I have ever had. Although we were packed all day long and it was one of the most hectic days I have ever experienced, I think what Applebee's did for the community was awesome. I really enjoyed getting to talk to all the vets and it was very touching for me to see everyone in uniform. I am grateful to have gotten the opportunity to serve all of those that have served our country!
Kudos for giving our Veteran's Recognition!!!

My husband (a WWII veteran), a friend (Korean veteran) my son (a veteran) was served a wonderful meal at the Massillon, Oh Applebee's. The staff was great. I cooked for 12 and a half hours on veterans day in littleton nh. I hope that we get to serve our veterans and active duty  for the coming years. It was a wonderful feeling being part of the applebees team on this day!

link_name: Participating Applebee's locations thank active-duty and retired military members with a free lunch on Veteran's Day during the company's inaugural salute to these important guests. Applebee's opens its 2,000th restaurant in Harlem in December.
Applebee's introduced Realburgers made with freshly ground never frozen 100% ground chuck.
Applebee's, along with IHOP, became part of DineEquity, Inc. (NYSE: DIN) behind the tagline 'Great Franchisees. Great Brands.' Michael J. Archer was appointed president of Applebees Services, Inc.
Applebee's Services, Inc. was purchased in November by IHOP Corp., led by Julia Stewart, creating the largest full-service restaurant company in the world.
Applebee's opened its first location in China; Applebee's was named one of three finalists for the Gartner High-Performance Workplace (HPW) Excellence Award.
2 for $20 was introduced and has been loved by our guests to this day.
Lloyd Hill announced transition to Chairman of the Board of Directors, and Dave Goebel is named President and Chief Executive Officer.
Main St. 'Ritas are launched  quenching guest's margarita cravings ever since.
Applebee's expanded international growth to Ecuador, Brazil and Jordan. Applebee's was recognized by IR magazine for its excellence in investor relations.
Introduced the 1st Sangria in casual dining grill & bars.
Applebee's made a successful partnership by introducing its Weight Watchers menu. Applebee's gained sales by rolling out Carside To Go pickup service.
